scurrilitas: <entryFree id="n43159" type="main" key="scurri_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scurrīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scurrilis</etym>, <sense id="n43159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">buffoonery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scurrility</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scurriliter: <entryFree id="n43160" type="main" key="scurri_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scurrīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. scurrilis <sense id="n43160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scurror: <entryFree id="n43161" type="main" key="scurror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scurror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n43161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [scurra, II.], <hi rend="ital">to act the part of a jester; to play the buffoon</hi> (Horat.): <cit><quote lang="la">scurror ego ipse mihi, populo tu,</quote> <trans><tr>I play the buffoon on my own account</tr>, <tr>to please myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scurrantis speciem praebere,</quote> <trans><tr>of a buffoonish parasite</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scurrula: <entryFree id="n43162" type="main" key="scurru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scurrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little buffoon</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scuta: <entryFree id="n43163" type="main" key="scu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. scutra.</entryFree>
scutale: <entryFree id="n43164" type="main" key="scu_ta_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scūtāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>scutum</etym>, <sense id="n43164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thong of a sling</hi> for throwing stones, etc. (corresp. with habena), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29, 6</bibl> (also cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 726</bibl> P.); 42, 65, 10.</sense></entryFree>
scutaneus: <entryFree id="n43165" type="main" key="scu_ta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scūtānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like an oblong shield</hi> (late Lat.): termini, Auct. Limit. p. 270 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
scutarius: <entryFree id="n43166" type="main" key="scu_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scūtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n43166.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a shield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricae,</quote> <trans><tr>shield-factories</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43166.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scū-tārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n43166.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A shield-maker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43166.3" n="2" level="3"> In the times of the later emperors, <hi rend="ital">a sort of guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armed with the</hi> scutum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3542 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 12, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scutatus: <entryFree id="n43167" type="main" key="scu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n43167.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Armed with a</hi> scutum (long shield): cohortes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:211" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 211</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43167.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n43167.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">scūtāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">troops bearing shields</hi> (opp. the equites): <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor milia scutatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43167.3" n="B" level="2"> = scutarius, II. 2.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3448</bibl> (belonging to A. D. 256).</sense></entryFree>
scutella: <entryFree id="n43168" type="main" key="scu^tella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŭtella</orth> (scutella, Ven. Carm. 11, 10, 7), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scutra; cf. 1. scutula</etym>, <sense id="n43168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salver</hi> or <hi rend="ital">waiter</hi>, of a nearly square form: <cit><quote lang="la">dulciculae potionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 46</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Also as a stand for vases,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 10</bibl></cit>; Ven. Fort. 3, 13, 4; 11, 10, 7.</sense></entryFree>
scutica: <entryFree id="n43169" type="main" key="scu^ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŭtĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whip</hi> (milder than flagellum): <cit><quote lang="la">ne scuticā sectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:480" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 480</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62, 8</bibl> (dub.): si quis Orbilius ferulā scuticāque cecidit, Domit. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scutigerulus: <entryFree id="n43170" type="hapax" key="scu_ti^ge^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scūtĭgĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scutum-gero</etym>, <sense id="n43170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shield-bearer</hi> (slave), <hi rend="ital">armor-bearer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scutilum: <entryFree id="n43171" type="gloss" key="scuti^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scutĭlum</orth> <itype>tenue et macrum et in quo tantum exilis pellicula cernitur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=329" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 329</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
scutra: <entryFree id="n43172" type="main" key="scu^_tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŭ_tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flat tray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dish</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">platter</hi> of a nearly square form, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 40</bibl>; 7, 45.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 618</bibl> P</sense></entryFree>
scutriscum: <entryFree id="n43173" type="main" key="scutriscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scutriscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scutra</etym>, <sense id="n43173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scutula: <entryFree id="n43174" type="main" key="scu^tu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŭtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scutra; cf. scutella</etym>. <sense id="n43174.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little dish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">platter</hi> of a nearly square form (cf. lanx), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 68, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:71:7" default="NO">8, 71, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43174.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of figures thus shaped, <hi rend="ital">a diamond-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhomb-</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lozenge-shaped figure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pavimenta) si sectilia sunt, nulli gradus in scutulis aut trigonis aut quadratis seu favis exstent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a tesselated floor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of checkered stuffs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 196</bibl></cit> (cf. scutulatus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 118</bibl>.—Of the shape of a country: <cit><quote lang="la">formam totius Britanniae eloquentissimi auctores oblongae scutulae vel bipenni assimulavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a patch on the eye</hi>, for a disguise: <cit><quote lang="la">scutula ob oculos lanea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43175" type="gloss" key="scu^tu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŭtŭla</orth> (in a Greek orthog. <orth extent="full" lang="la">scy-tăla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">scytălē</orth>; v. II. and III.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skuta/lh</foreign> (a staff, stick). <sense id="n43175.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wooden roller</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cylinder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor biremes, subjectis scutulis, impulsas vectibus in interiorem partem transduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43175.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A secret writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret letter</hi> among the Lacedaemonians (it being written on a slip of papyrus wrapped round a <foreign lang="greek">skuta/lh;</foreign> pure Lat. clava): <cit><quote lang="la">scytala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scytale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 23, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 15</bibl> (written as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 10, 3</bibl>, habes <foreign lang="greek">skuta/lhn *lakwnikh/n</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n43175.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cylindrical snake</hi> (of equal thickness throughout), Plin. <pb n="1651" /> <cb n="SCYL" /> 82, 5, 19, § 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 717</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, § 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17</bibl>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
scutulatus: <entryFree id="n43176" type="main" key="scu^tu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŭtŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. scutula, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diamond-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lozenge-shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">checkered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rete (aranearum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 25, 61, § 185</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of stuffs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 1, 48</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scŭtŭlāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a checked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chequered garment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerulea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 97</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 15, 7, 11; also: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scŭtŭlāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 27, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scutulum: <entryFree id="n43177" type="main" key="scu_tu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scūtŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scutum</etym>. <sense id="n43177.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small shield</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43177.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutula operta,</quote> <trans><tr>the shoulder-blades</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
scutum: <entryFree id="n43178" type="main" key="scu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n43178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scū-tus</orth>, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 13</bibl>) [<foreign lang="greek">sku=tos</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n43178.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An oblong shield</hi>, made of boards fastened together, and covered with leather, <hi rend="ital">a buckler</hi> (whereas clipeus denotes a round shield, target of metal; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 18</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">scutum pro clipeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>: pedestre, <hi rend="ital">of the infantry</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:16" default="NO">9, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestria,</quote> <trans><tr>of the cavalry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad galeas induendas scutisque tegimenta detrahenda tempus defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis ex cortice factis aut viminibus intextis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublato scuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abjecto scuto fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non modo non abjecto, sed ne rejecto quidem scuto fugere videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum reliquisse praecipuum flagitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas et scuta reclinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 539</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erectum altius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43178.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">heavyarmed soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">men bearing shields</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum, ordine circumdatum trino scutorum, oppugnabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agilo, scutorum densitate contectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 12, 18 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n43178.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shield</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sheiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safeguard</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sed ne quod tamen scutum dare in judicio viderentur eis, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Tull. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuto vobis magis quam gladio opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (for which, just before: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia libertatis non licentiae ad impugnandos alios): Fabius novam de Hannibale victoriam commentus est, non pugnare. Hinc illud ex populo, ut Imperii scutum vocaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus, scutum meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scybilites: <entryFree id="n43179" type="greek" key="scybili_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scybilītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skubili/ths</foreign>（<foreign lang="greek">oi=)nos</foreign>), <sense id="n43179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine in Galatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scydra: <entryFree id="n43180" type="main" key="Scydra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scydra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scylace: <entryFree id="n43181" type="main" key="Scy^la^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scylăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skula/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n43181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Cyzicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scylaceum: <entryFree id="n43182" type="main" key="Scy^la^ce_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scylăcēum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scylăcīum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skula/keion,</foreign> <sense id="n43182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the coast of Bruttium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Squillace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navifragum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 553</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scylăcēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> Scylaceum, <hi rend="ital">Scylacean</hi>: sinus, Mel. l. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">Plin. l. l.: litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 702</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scylax: <entryFree id="n43183" type="main" key="Scy^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scylax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a native of Halicarnassus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and friend of Panœtius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scylla: <entryFree id="n43184" type="main" key="Scylla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scylla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sku/lla.</foreign> <sense id="n43184.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated rock between Italy and Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite to Charybdis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scylla saxum est, Charybdis mare, utrumque noxium appulsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo freto est scopulus Scylla item Charybdis mare vorticosum, ambo clara saevitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas Seneca remarks: indices mihi omnia de Charybdi certiora. Nam Scyllam saxum esse et quidem non terribile navigantibus, optime scio: Charybdis an respondeat fabulis, perscribi mihi desidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl> (4, 11), 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 420</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 730</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Personified,</quote> <trans><tr>the daughter of Phorcys</tr>, <tr>transformed by Circe</tr>, <tr>through jealousy</tr>, <tr>into a sea-monster</tr>, <tr>with dogs about the haunches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 199" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:52 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 52 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:424 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 424 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 732</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 108</bibl>; cf. also II.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scyllaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Scylla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scyllœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scyllaei litoris undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:334" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:306" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:280" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 200</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: ne Scyllaeo illo aeris alieni in freto ad columnam<cb n="SCYT" />  adhaeresceret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obloquiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43184.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Nisus of Megara</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for love of Minos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off her father</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon which his life depended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was transformed in consequence into the bird Ciris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 198" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 150</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 488 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:393 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 393 al.</bibl>—The poets (even Ovid) sometimes confound the two Scyllas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:893" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 893</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 39; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:500" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 500</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 74</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scyllaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Scyllœan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), = <hi rend="ital">Megarean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:333" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 333</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scyllaeus: <entryFree id="n43185" type="main" key="Scyllaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scyllaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Scylla, I. and II.</entryFree>
scymnus: <entryFree id="n43186" type="greek" key="scymnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scymnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sku/mnos,</foreign> <sense id="n43186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whelp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1036" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1036</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scyphulus: <entryFree id="n43187" type="hapax" key="scy^phu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scyphŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scyphus</etym>, <sense id="n43187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cup</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 463</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scyphus: <entryFree id="n43188" type="greek" key="scy^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scyphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sku/fos,</foreign> <sense id="n43188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cup</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goblet</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calix, poculum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 38</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 278</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:33 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 33 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 40, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:163" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 17, 48, § 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuseras heri inter scyphos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>while drinking</tr>, <tr>over our wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabri scyphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 37, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scyreis: <entryFree id="n43189" type="main" key="Scy_re_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrēïs, Scȳrētĭcus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrĭas</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrĭus</orth>, v. Scyros.</entryFree>
scyritae: <entryFree id="n43190" type="main" key="Scyri_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scyrītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabled people of India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with feet like serpents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scyros: <entryFree id="n43191" type="main" key="Scy_ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳros</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sku=ros,</foreign> <sense id="n43191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite Eubœa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Skyro; here Achilles was concealed by Lycomedes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose daughter Deïdamia became by him the mother of Pyrrhus; nom.</hi> Scyros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 18</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Scyron, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 464</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scyrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 19</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43191.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Scyros</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scyrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 233</bibl></cit> (Jahn, Syrius): <cit><quote lang="la">Deïdamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Scyria virgo, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 16: juvenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pyrrhus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 976" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 976</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Pyrrhus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <trans><tr>his forces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 477</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43191.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrē-tĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Scyros</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 20, § 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43191.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scyrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Deïdamia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 682</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrĭădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Scyrian maidens</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 367</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43191.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Scyrian maiden</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scyrus: <entryFree id="n43192" type="main" key="Scy_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scȳrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Scyros.</entryFree>
scytala: <entryFree id="n43193" type="main" key="scyta^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scytăla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">scytălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. 2. scutula <sense id="n43193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> and II.</sense></entryFree>
scytalosagittipelliger: <entryFree id="n43194" type="main" key="Scy^ta^lo^sa^gitti^pelli^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scytălŏsăgittĭpellĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scytale, i. e. clava-sagitta-pellis-gero</etym>, <sense id="n43194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Club-shaft-and-hide-bearer</hi>, an epithet of Hercules, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 124, n. 61 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
scytanum: <entryFree id="n43195" type="main" key="scyta_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scytānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means to facilitate the taking of colors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mordant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 88</bibl>; v. Sillig ad h. l. (al. scytatum).</sense></entryFree>
scytha: <entryFree id="n43196" type="main" key="Scy^tha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scytha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sku/qhs,</foreign> <sense id="n43196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian; sing.</hi> form Scytha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 454</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 3, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 25, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Scythes (class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 167" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 167</bibl>.— Mostly in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sku/qai.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n43196.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Scythians</hi>, a general designation of the nomadic tribes of the north of Europe and Asia, beyond the Black Sea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:3" default="NO">1, 2, 3</bibl> sq.; 3, 7, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 55</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43196.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scytha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. comm.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scythian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 906" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 906</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:437" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 437</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1210" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:28:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43196.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scy-thĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Scythians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scythia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:6" default="NO">2, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:6" default="NO">3, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 50, 51, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:941" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 27, § 941</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 34, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 1</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n43196.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Scythian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 20, § 53</bibl>: <cb n="SECE" /> Ister, Ov.Tr.5, 1, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Tanais</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:9:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 649</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:285" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:588" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Taurian Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 331</bibl></cit> et saep.—In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; more usually called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 43, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:146" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 146</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43196.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n43196.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Scythian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 360</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:343" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 343</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43196.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The Scythian emerald</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1</bibl>, §§ 67 and 75.—</sense><sense id="n43196.8" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Scythian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scythes: <entryFree id="n43197" type="main" key="Scy^thes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Scytha.</entryFree>
scythice: <entryFree id="n43198" type="main" key="Scy^thi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. Scytha, C. <sense id="n43198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scythopolis: <entryFree id="n43199" type="main" key="Scy^tho^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skuqo/polis,</foreign> <sense id="n43199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Palestine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bysān</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 18, 16, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 12, 29</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythŏpŏlītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Scythopolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 12, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scythotauri: <entryFree id="n43200" type="main" key="Scy^tho^tauri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scythŏtauri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian tribe in the Tauric Chersonesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scyzinum: <entryFree id="n43201" type="main" key="scyzinum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scyzinum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> itaeomelis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
se: <entryFree id="n43202" type="main" key="se_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē</orth>, <sense id="n43202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. reflex.</hi>, v. sui.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43203" type="main" key="se_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēd</orth>). <sense id="n43203.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi>, v. sine <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n43203.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Prep. insepar.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43203.2" n="a" level="4"> For sine, <hi rend="ital">without;</hi> e. g. securus (= sine curā).—</sense><sense id="n43203.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by itself;</hi> as sepono, <hi rend="ital">to lay aside.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43203.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē</orth> = semi, <hi rend="ital">half;</hi> as selibra, semodius.—</sense><sense id="n43203.5" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē</orth> = sex; as semestris.</sense></entryFree>
sebaceus: <entryFree id="n43204" type="hapax" key="se_ba_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēbācĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sebum; cf. cereus</etym>, <sense id="n43204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tallow-candle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sebadius: <entryFree id="n43205" type="main" key="Se^ba_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕbādĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Sabazius.</entryFree>
sebalis: <entryFree id="n43206" type="hapax" key="se_ba_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēbālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sebum; cf. cereus</etym>, <sense id="n43206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of tallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sebaste: <entryFree id="n43207" type="main" key="Se^baste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕbastē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sebasth/,</foreign> Augusta, <sense id="n43207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Samaria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Epit. Paul. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sebazius: <entryFree id="n43208" type="main" key="Se^ba_zi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕbāzĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Sabadius.</entryFree>
sebethos: <entryFree id="n43209" type="main" key="Se_be_thos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēbēthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n43209.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small stream in Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Maddalona</hi>, on which lay Neapolis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:263" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 263</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43209.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēbēthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sebethos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sebethian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 734</bibl></cit>: lympha, Col. poët. 10, 134.</sense></entryFree>
sebinnus: <entryFree id="n43210" type="main" key="Se_binnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēbinnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sēvīnus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Upper Italy</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago d</hi>'<hi rend="ital">Iseo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19, 23, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sebo: <entryFree id="n43211" type="hapax" key="se_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sebum</etym>, <sense id="n43211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make of tallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelas,</quote> <trans><tr>to dip tallow-candles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sebosus: <entryFree id="n43212" type="main" key="se_bo_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of tallow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tallowy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greasy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 86, § 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

sebum: <entryFree id="n43214" type="main" key="se_bum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēbum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sēvum</orth>; cf. the letter B; and Freund ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:page=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. p. 34</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grease</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">adeps, pingue),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 85, § 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 41, 763</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secabilis: <entryFree id="n43215" type="main" key="se^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seco</etym>, <sense id="n43215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be cut</hi> (post-class.), Lact. de Ira Dei, 10, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 36, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secabilitas: <entryFree id="n43216" type="main" key="se^ca_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>secabilis</etym>, <sense id="n43216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">capacity for being cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divided</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. secale: <entryFree id="n43217" type="main" key="se^ca_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rye;</hi> or, acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">black spelt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 40, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secamenta: <entryFree id="n43218" type="hapax" key="se^ca_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>seco</etym>, <sense id="n43218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carved work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secande: <entryFree id="n43219" type="main" key="Secande_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Secandē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secedo: <entryFree id="n43220" type="main" key="se_ce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n43220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi> (class.; not in Cæs.; but cf. secessio). </sense><sense id="n43220.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43220.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secedant improbi, secernant se a bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 490</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosecutus eram viatico secedentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abite et de viā secedite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de coetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a vestro potui secedere lusu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam nostro secedere corpore possem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 467</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43220.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of inanim. subjects, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw;</hi> and in the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be distant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(luna) quantum solis secedit ab orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imis terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 6, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(villa) decem et septem milibus passuum ab urbe secessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; Claud. Epith. Pall. et Cell. 63.—</sense><sense id="n43220.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43220.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <pb n="1652" /> <cb n="SECE" /> <hi rend="ital">retire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secede huc nunc jam procul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in abditam partem aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utraque latera (cohortes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 6:6:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 6, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deliberandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad consultandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Spartana vetat secedere amantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">secedit humumque Effodit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 185</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43220.6" n="b" level="4"> In post-Aug. authors (esp. in Suet.), <hi rend="ital">to retire</hi> from public into private life; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integrā aetate ac valetudine statuit repente secedere seque e medio quam longissime amovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc e comitatu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insulam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 5</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43220.7" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To seek the exclusive society of</hi> any one, <hi rend="ital">to retire from the world</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad optimos viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 1, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43220.8" n="2" level="3"> Polit., <hi rend="ital">to separate one's self</hi> by rebellion, <hi rend="ital">to revolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secede</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">deficio, descisco): ut anno XVI. post reges exactos propter nimiam dominationem potentium secederent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Corn. 1, p. 450</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ipsa plebes armata a patribus secessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injussu consulum in Sacrum Montem secessisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to have marched out in rebellion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in Sacrum Montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:23" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Janiculum (plebs),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 15, § 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43220.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare; perh. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">antequam ego incipio secedere et aliā parte considere,</quote> <trans><tr>to dissent from the opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fesso corpore sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui solitarius separatusque a communi malo civitatis secesserit,</quote> <trans><tr>has withdrawn himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad stilum secedet,</quote> <trans><tr>shall give himself up to writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in te ipse secede,</quote> <trans><tr>retire within yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 25:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 25, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
secerno: <entryFree id="n43221" type="main" key="se_cerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-cerno</orth>, <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype> (old <sense id="n43221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> secernier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 263</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n43221.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> (freq. and class.; not in Cæs.; cf.: sepono, sejungo, secludo); constr. with simple <case>acc.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">ab aliquā re;</hi> less freq. <hi rend="ital">ex aliquā re;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n43221.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non animalia solum Corpora sejungunt, sed terras ac mare totum Secernunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seorsum partem utramque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietes, quibus sis usurus ad feturam, bimestri tempore ante secernendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">stamen secernit harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsos sine ordine flores Secernunt calathis,</quote> <trans><tr>separate in baskets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:267" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil (praedae) in publicum secernendo augenti rem privatam militi favit,</quote> <trans><tr>setting apart for the public treasury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter illa piae secrevit litora genti,</quote> <trans><tr>hath set apart for the pious race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:63" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde pares centum denos secrevit in orbes Romulus,</quote> <trans><tr>separated</tr>, <tr>divided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:127" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43221.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or (less freq.) with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">a terris altum secernere caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aëre caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Europen ab Afro (medius liquor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muro denique secernantur a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inermes ab armatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem a populo (in spectaculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab Etruscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 10</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam incipiat admissura fieri, mares a feminis secretos habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">saepta ab aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:912" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 912</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:552" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 552</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera ab aethereā conjunctione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus a reliquo cibo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilis ab eo cibo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">secreti ab aliis ad tribunos adducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretis alterius ab altero criminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se e grege imperatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum e praetextatis compluribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monile ex omni gazā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me gelidum nemus Nympharumque leves chori Secernunt populo,</quote> <trans><tr>separate</tr>, <tr>distinguish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43221.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissociate</hi> (syn.: internosco, distinguo). </sense><sense id="n43221.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosce ego homines excipio et secerno libenter,</quote> <trans><tr>set apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43221.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, or <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <case>abl.</case>: ut venustas et pulchritudo corporis secerni non potest a valetudine; <cit><quote lang="la">sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum a corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium genus (laudationum) a praeceptis nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 341</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam pronuntiationem ab oratore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: dicendi facultatem<cb n="SECE" />  a majore vitae laude, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua a publicis consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec a probris ac sceleribus ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cur me a ceteris clarissimis viris in hoc officio secernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica privatis, sacra profanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 397</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43221.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To distinguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandum amicum a vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis acute, quae sunt secernenda, distinguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec natura potest justo secernere iniquum, Dividit ut bona diversis, fugienda petendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpi honestum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43221.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reus frugalissimum quemque secerneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus idoneos senatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrē-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">severed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separated;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi> (as an <pos>adj.</pos> not freq. till after the Aug. period; not in Cic.; syn.: sejunctus, seclusus). </sense><sense id="n43221.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ducem suum, neve secretum imperium propriave signa haberent, miscuit manipulos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">electa (uva defertur) in secretam corbulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 478</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 57</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n43221.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43221.11" n="1" level="3"> Of places or things pertaining to them, <hi rend="ital">out of the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lonely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">solus, remotus, arcanus): secreta petit loca, balnea vitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus (opp. celeber),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:196" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars domus (the gynaeceum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:737" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 737</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretissimus locus (navis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 100, 6</bibl></cit>: vastum ubique silentium, secreti colles, <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">abandoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserted by the enemy</hi>, = deserti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter (with semita),</quote> <trans><tr>solitary</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 103</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 32, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of persons and transactions, <hi rend="ital">private</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invadit secretissimos tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuis porticibus secretus agitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquis ex secretis studiis fructus,</quote> <trans><tr>private studies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">studia (opp. forum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit> et saep. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n43221.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">retirement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secrecy; a solitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitary place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retreat</hi> (syn.: solitudo, secessus); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stilus secreto gaudeat atque omnes arbitros reformidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreti longi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altum abditumque secretum, Phn. Ep. 2, 17, 22: dulce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO">12, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 23, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 314</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a vulgo et scaenā in secreta removere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendaeque procul secreta Sibyllae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 594</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis secretorum comes (eloquentia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1,
