4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cameli solitudines aut secreta certe petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 173</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pars Suevorum in secretiora Germaniae porrigitur,</quote> <trans><tr>into the more remote parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 41</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43221.13" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: in secreto, <hi rend="ital">in a secret place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus in secreto lbi tereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus in secreto agebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:4:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43221.14" n="2" level="3"> That is removed from acquaintance (cf. abditus), <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreta ducis pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:5:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretas advocat artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae (with familiares),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina (the Sibylline odes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam imperii pignora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam secretum alter ab altero haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertus ex secretioribus ministeriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia (opp. publica largitio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud (nomen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium stomachi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 77, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for the <pos>adv.</pos> secreto: <cit><quote lang="la">tu (Anna) secreta pyram tecto interiore Erige,</quote> <trans><tr>in secret</tr>, <tr>secretly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 494</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stridere secreta divisos aure susurros,</quote> <trans><tr>secretly in each one's ear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 78</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43221.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret conversation; a mystery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretum petenti non nisi adhibito filio dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc me persecutus secretum petit,</quote> <trans><tr>a secret interview</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petito secreto futura aperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Piur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra cum amicis secreta habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi secreta proferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla lex jubet amicorum secreta non eloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium secreta rimari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribile secretum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 17</bibl> <cb n="SECE" /> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor omnis secreti capacissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:5 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 5 al.</bibl>—Concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">lucos ac nemora consecrant deorumque nominibus appellant secretum illud, quod solā reverentiā vident,</quote> <trans><tr>that mysterious being</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">introitus, aperta, secreta velut in annales referebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gens non astuta aperit adhuc secreta pectoris licentia joci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio animi secreta detegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 6, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 3</bibl> et saep.—Concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Minerva) hanc legem dederat, sua ne secreta viderent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the mysteries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 556</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 749</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">secretiora quaedam,</quote> <trans><tr>magic arts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in secretis ejus reperti sunt duo libelli,</quote> <trans><tr>among his private papers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43221.16" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., separate from what is common, i. e. <hi rend="ital">uncommon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recondite</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. passages of Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">(figurae) secretae et extra vulgarem usum positae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: interpretatio linguae secretioris, quas Graeci <foreign lang="greek">glw/ssas</foreign> vocant, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the more uncommon words</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 35</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">glossemata id est voces minus usitatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n43221.17" n="4" level="3"> In Lucr., of any thing separated from what belongs to it, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wanting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprived of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without something;</hi> with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec porro secreta cibo natura animantum Propagare genus possit (corresp. to sine imbribus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(corpora) secreta teporis Sunt ac frigoris omnino calidique vaporis (corresp. to spoliata colore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 843</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms: secreto (class.), secrete (post-class.), and secretim (late Lat. and very rare). * </sense><sense id="n43221.18" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to A.) <hi rend="ital">Apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus (hortis) suo loco dicam secretius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43221.19" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">In secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly; without witnesses; in private.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43221.20" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrē-tō</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum, quid solus secum secreto ille agat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreto illum adjutabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreto hoc audi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid secreto velle loqui te Aiebas mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreto te huc seduxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 8, 4</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreto ab aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreto agere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:79" default="NO">9, 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43221.21" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētē</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43221.22" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretius emittitur inflatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43221.23" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētim</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secespita: <entryFree id="n43222" type="main" key="se^cespi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcespĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>seco</etym>, <sense id="n43222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long iron sacrificial knife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. Fest. pp. 348 and 349 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 262</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secessio: <entryFree id="n43223" type="main" key="se_cessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>secedo, I. B.</etym>. <sense id="n43223.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to secedo, I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">A going aside</hi> to consult, etc., <hi rend="ital">a withdrawal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seductiones testium, secessio subscriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites vesperi secessionem faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primores, secessione factā, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>having withdrawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 14, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43223.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to secedo, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">A political insurrectionary withdrawal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">separation; a schism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secession</hi> (the prevailing signif. of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: defectio, seditio): ultima rabies secessio ab suis habebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secessionem tu illam existimasti, Caesar, initio, non bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum demissi populo fasces, tum provocationes omnium rerum, tum secessio (pern. secessiones) plebis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per secessionem armati Aventinum occupavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in secessione Crustumerinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 81</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">secessio ab decemviris facta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Aventinum montem secessionem factam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
secessiones: <entryFree id="n43224" type="gloss" key="secessi^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">secessĭōnes</orth>, <itype>narrationes</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n43224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> [perh. from secere; whence insecere, inseque, and insectiones, = narrationes, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 8</bibl>].</sense></entryFree>
secessus: <entryFree id="n43225" type="main" key="se_cessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcessus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>secedo</etym>, <sense id="n43225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">departure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n43225.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi quodam secessu mentis atque animi facto a corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43225.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43225.3" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to secedo, I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Retirement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitude</hi> (the prevailing signif. of the word; syn. solitudo). </sense><sense id="n43225.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina secessum scribentis et otia quaerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: medium tempus <pb n="1653" /> <cb n="SECO" /> in otio secessuque egit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>: in secessu ruris sui Sabini, id. Fragm. Vit. Hor. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium et secessus non semper possunt contingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:23" default="NO">10, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">specie secessus exul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus e senatoribus Rhodii secessus comes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratum litus amoeni secessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43225.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a retreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in secessu longo locus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 12, 3</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:83" default="NO" valid="yes">83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—Of <hi rend="ital">a privy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43225.6" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): ideoque mihi videtur M. Tullius tantum intulisse eloquentiae lumen, quod in hos quoque studiorum secessus excurrit, <hi rend="ital">into these remote departments of study</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">remote from forensic debates</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in secessu quam in fronte beatior,</quote> <trans><tr>in his own mind</tr>, <tr>inwardly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43225.7" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to secedo, I. B. 2.) For the usual secessio (II.), <hi rend="ital">a political secession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratae plebis secessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43225.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place of retirement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drain</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 15, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 7, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secius: <entryFree id="n43226" type="main" key="se_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. secus.</entryFree>
secivum: <entryFree id="n43227" type="gloss" key="se^ci_vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcīvum</orth> <itype>librum est, quod secespitā secatur</itype>, Fest. pp. 348 and 349 Müll.</entryFree>
secludo: <entryFree id="n43228" type="main" key="se_clu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-clūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n43228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi> [claudo], <hi rend="ital">to shut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut in a separate place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seclude</hi> (rare but class.; syn.: secerno, sejungo). </sense><sense id="n43228.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: incientes (oves) secludere, <hi rend="ital">to shut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi>, Varr, R. R. 2, 2, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 359</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc eum rapiam, ubi non seclusa aliqua aquula teneatur, sed unde universum flumen erumpat,</quote> <trans><tr>confined streamlets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina antro seclusa relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 446</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> mid.: ille sub extremā pendens secluditur alā, <hi rend="ital">shuts himself off</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">protects himself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43228.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shut off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur luna queat terram secludere solis Lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrum cornu, quod erat a sinistro seclusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors seclusa ab reliquis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 55</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab suis interceptum et seclusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar munitione flumen a monte seclusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare Tyrrhenum a Lucrino molibus seclusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula ad eam rem seclusa,</quote> <trans><tr>set apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43228.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n43228.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To shut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seclude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a libero spiritu atque a communi luce seclusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43228.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: corpore vitam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 1</bibl>: secludite curas, <hi rend="ital">shut out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclude</hi>, i. q. excludite, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 562</bibl> Serv.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēclūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sundered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secluded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his devium quoddam iter esse seclusum a concilio deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seclusum nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 704</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in secluso,</quote> <trans><tr>in a remote</tr>, <tr>secluded place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
seclum: <entryFree id="n43229" type="main" key="se_clum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēclum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. seculum.</entryFree>
seclusorium: <entryFree id="n43230" type="hapax" key="se_clu_so_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēclūsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>secludo</etym>, <sense id="n43230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for shutting up fowls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seclusus: <entryFree id="n43231" type="main" key="se_clu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēclūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from secludo.</entryFree>
seco: <entryFree id="n43232" type="main" key="se^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum</itype> (<sense id="n43232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> secaturus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root sak-, to cut; whence securis, sĕcula, serra (secra), segmen, sexus, saxum, etc.; cf. sīca, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kei/w, kea/zw, sxi/zw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi> (class.; syn.: caedo, scindo). </sense><sense id="n43232.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43232.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">leges duodecim tabularum, si plures forent, quibus rens esset judicatus, secare, si vellent, atque partiri corpus addicti sibi hominis permiserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:48 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 48 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et judicatos in partes secari a creditoribus leges erant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape cultrum, seca Digitum vel aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:38 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 38 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal secari ac dividi potest, nullum est eorum individuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: pabulum secari non posse, <hi rend="ital">be cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mown</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sectae herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinam,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut to pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:124" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 77, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui collum gladio suā dexterā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to divide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergora in frusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 212</bibl></cit>: dona auro gravia sectoque elephanto, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of carved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrought ivory</hi> (an imitation of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">pristo\s e)le/fas,</foreign> Od. 18, 196), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 464</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 17</bibl></cit>: sectis <cb n="SECR" /> nitebat marmoribus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 114</bibl>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ideo ferrum secandi vim non perdidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prave sectus unguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secti lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:20:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 20, 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43232.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43232.4" n="1" level="3"> Med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> surgically; <hi rend="ital">to operate on; to cut off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amputate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excise</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in corpore si quid ejusmodi est, quod reliquo corpori noceat, id uri secarique patimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia secandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 11, 69, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varices Mario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 35</bibl></cit> (for which, exciditur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 31</bibl>); cf. of the same: C. Marius cum secaretur, ut supra dixi, principio vetuit se alligari; <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam ante Marium solutus dicitur esse sectus,</quote> <trans><tr>was cut</tr>, <tr>operated upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43232.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castrate</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">puer avari sectus arte mangonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sectus Gallus (corresp. to eviratus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 41, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43232.6" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n43232.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To scratch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi> (cf. caedo, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">ambo (postes) ab infimo tarmes secat,</quote> <trans><tr>the worms are gnawing them</tr>, <tr>they are wormeaten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctantis acuto ne secer ungui,</quote> <trans><tr>lest I should be torn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rigido sectas invenit ungue genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:148" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneras plantas tibi (glacies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora vepres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura (sentes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pete ferro Corpus et intorto verbere terga seca,</quote> <trans><tr>cut</tr>, <tr>lacerate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sectus flagellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:14 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 5, 14 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem podagra secat,</quote> <trans><tr>gnaws</tr>, <tr>torments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:71:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 71, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Martial: podagra cheragraque secatur Gaius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:92:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 92, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43232.8" n="2" level="3"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/mnein,</foreign> and our <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n43232.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quos (populos) secans interluit Allia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios Aethiopas (Nilus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios agros (Tiberis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium agmen (Turnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum (limes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum (zonae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectus orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in longas orbem qui secuere vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43232.10" n="b" level="4"> With the idea of motion, <hi rend="ital">to cut through</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to run</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphinum similes, qui per maria umida nando Carpathium Libycumque secant,</quote> <trans><tr>cut through</tr>, <tr>cleave</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A.5, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor Puppe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum puppe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vada nota (amnis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:370" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales avis ... geminis secat aëra pennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera pennis (avis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 406</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 409</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras (cornus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos (Cyllenia proles),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 4, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub nubibus arcum (Iris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.— Secare viam (vias), the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/mnein o(do/n,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">to take one's way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to travel a road</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille viam secat ad naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:899" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 899</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc velut diversae secari coeperunt viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43232.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. C. 1. and 2.). * </sense><sense id="n43232.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lash</hi> in speaking, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satirize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secuit Lucilius Urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:114" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43232.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To divide</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum causas in plura genera secuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in plures partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulose in partes sectā divisionis diligentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae natura singularia sunt secant (corresp. to divido),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectae ad tenuitatem suam vires (just before: distinguendo. dividendo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in Hor., like dirimo (II.), of disputes, <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to decide</hi> them: <cit><quote lang="la">quo multae magnaeque secantur judice lites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: magnas res, <hi rend="ital">to cure</hi> (as it were, by a light operation), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 15</bibl>.—And once in Verg.: secare spem (the figure borrowed from the phrases secare mare, auras, viam): quae cuique est fortuna hodie, quam quisque secat spem, <hi rend="ital">whatever hope each follows</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">indulges in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 107</bibl> (secat, sequitur, tenet, habet; <cit><quote lang="la">ut: Ille viam secat ad naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 899</bibl></cit>: unde et sectas dicimus, habitus animorum et instituta philosophiae circa disciplinam, Serv.).</sense></entryFree>
secordia: <entryFree id="n43233" type="main" key="se_cordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcordĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. socordia <sense id="n43233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
secretarium: <entryFree id="n43234" type="main" key="se_cre_ta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>secretus</etym>, <sense id="n43234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitary</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">secret place</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n43234.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: ignes qui terrae secretariis continentur, App. de Mundo, p. 64, 39; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 358, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43234.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a sittingplace</hi><cb n="SECT" />  (set apart). </sense><sense id="n43234.3" n="1" level="3"> Of judges, <hi rend="ital">a council chamber</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 7, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43234.4" n="2" level="3"> Of ecclesiastics, <hi rend="ital">a consistory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclave</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. S. Mart. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 32, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secrete: <entryFree id="n43235" type="main" key="se_cre_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. secerno, <sense id="n43235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi>, <pos>adv.</pos> 2. <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign></sense></entryFree>
secretim: <entryFree id="n43236" type="hapax" key="se_cre_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. secerno <sense id="n43236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
secretio: <entryFree id="n43237" type="hapax" key="se_cre_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>secerno</etym>, <sense id="n43237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dividing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sundering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est interitus quasi discessus et secretio ac diremptus earum partium, quae ante interitum junctione aliquā tenebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
secreto: <entryFree id="n43238" type="main" key="se_cre_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. secerno, <sense id="n43238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
secretus: <entryFree id="n43239" type="main" key="se_cre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from secerno.</entryFree>
secta: <entryFree id="n43240" type="main" key="secta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">secta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> of seco, sc. via, v. seco, I. C. 2., and II. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></etym>; prop., <sense id="n43240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trodden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beaten way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a path; footsteps;</hi> hence, trop., a (prescribed) <hi rend="ital">way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">method</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principles</hi> of conduct or procedure (syn.: ratio, via, etc.); most freq. in the phrase sectam (alicujus) sequi (persequi, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to follow in the footsteps</hi> (of any one); hence, also, sectam (alicujus) secuti, <hi rend="ital">a party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sect.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43240.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos, qui hanc sectam rationemque vitae, re magis quam verbis, secuti sumus,</quote> <trans><tr>mode of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:6" default="NO">12, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 85:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum nos hominum sectam atque instituta persequimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus sectam sequi, cujus imperio parere potissimum vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi ejus auctoritatem, cujus sectam atque imperium secutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis natura habet quasi viam quandam et sectam quam sequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negant se pro Vitruvio sectamque ejus secutis precatum venisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">42, 31: juvenes hortatur, ut illam ire viam pergant et eidem incumbere sectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:121 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 121 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitioris sectam plerumque secuntur Quamlibet et fortes,</quote> <trans><tr>follow</tr>, <tr>adhere to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallae sectam meam exsecutae, mihi comites, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43240.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">doctrines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sect</hi> (not freq. until the post-Aug. per.; syn.: schola, disciplina). </sense><sense id="n43240.3" n="A" level="2"> In philosophic lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis tuum, Brute, judicium probo, qui eorum philosophorum sectam secutus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Stoicos et Epicuri sectam secutos pugna perpetua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 35</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad morem certas in philosophia sectas sequendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque me cujusdam sectae velut quādam superstitione imbutus addixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assumptā Stoicorum arrogantiā sectāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrio Cynicam sectam professo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem Stoicae sectae praeferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duos diversarum sectarum velut duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 59</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43240.4" n="B" level="2"> In jurisprudence: <cit><quote lang="la">hi duo primum veluti diversas sectas fecerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>schools</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43240.5" n="C" level="2"> In medicine, <hi rend="ital">a school</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia est Hippocratis secta, alia Asclepiadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43240.6" n="D" level="2"> In religion, <hi rend="ital">a sect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimae sectae et haereses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nazaraenorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43240.7" n="E" level="2"> Rarely of a <hi rend="ital">class</hi> or <hi rend="ital">guild</hi> of men: <cit><quote lang="la">sincera et innoxia pastoriae illius sectae integritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43240.8" n="F" level="1"> In Appul., <hi rend="ital">a band</hi> of robbers, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4</bibl>, pp. 150, 29, and 153, 22.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43241" type="main" key="secta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">secta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. seco, I. B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n43241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parts of the body operated upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secta recentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sectacula: <entryFree id="n43242" type="hapax" key="secta_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectācŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. secta</etym>, <sense id="n43242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a succession</hi> in birth, <hi rend="ital">descent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lineage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sectarius: <entryFree id="n43243" type="hapax" key="secta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seco</etym>, <sense id="n43243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gelded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">castrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vervex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll.: sextarius vervex, qui gregem agnorum praecedens ducit, i.e. <hi rend="ital">bellwether</hi>, from secta).</sense></entryFree>
sectatio: <entryFree id="n43244" type="main" key="secta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. sector</etym>, <sense id="n43244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pursuing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">striving after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 11, 19</bibl></cit>; trop., <hi rend="ital">emulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sectator: <entryFree id="n43245" type="main" key="secta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a follower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adherent;</hi> in the <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suite</hi> (syn. assectator). </sense><sense id="n43245.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare but class.): at sectabantur multi. Quid opus est sectatoribus? (of the train accompanying a candidate) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 71</bibl> (shortly afterwards, assectatio and assectari); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Fabia, quae est de numero sectatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34, 71</bibl></cit>: num Gabinii comes<pb n="1654" /> <cb n="SECT" />  vel sectator? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerorum rixantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sectator domi, comes in publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet (Thrasea) sectatores vel potius satellites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis sectatorum dilapsis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectator quaestoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43245.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43245.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A follower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adherent</hi> of a leader or sect (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic non tam discipulos quam sectatores aliquot habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors sectatorum Aristotelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae aut philosophiae sectatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43245.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One who practises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a follower</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Tit. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sectilis: <entryFree id="n43246" type="main" key="secti^li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectĭlĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seco</etym>. <sense id="n43246.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided</hi>, etc. (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta,</quote> <trans><tr>made of small cut stones</tr>, <tr>mosaic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43246.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may be cut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrum,</quote> <trans><tr>cut-leek</tr>, <tr>chives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:293" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 11</bibl> (cf. sectivus): <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 44, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 231</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sectio: <entryFree id="n43247" type="main" key="secti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cutting off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cutting up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43247.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so only post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sectio et partitio corporis (humani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:39" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyma a primā sectione praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43247.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. * </sense><sense id="n43247.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cutting</hi> of diseased parts of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">(mandragoras) bibitur ante sectiones punctionesque, ne sentiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 94, § 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43247.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A castration</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 199, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43247.5" n="C" level="2"> Publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">a dividing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parcelling out</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">distribution by auction</hi> of captured or confiscated goods (the prevailing and class. signif.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: auctio, licitatio): cujus praedae sectio non venierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:45:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 45, 85</bibl></cit>: sectionem ejus oppidi universam Caesar vendidit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Phil. 2:26:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:71" default="NO">2, 29, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43247.6" n="D" level="2"> Hence, of <hi rend="ital">the confiscation</hi> of property by tax-gatherers: <cit><quote lang="la">sectiones publicanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43247.7" n="E" level="2"> Geometrical t. t., <hi rend="ital">division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">section</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de ratione dividendi, de sectione in infinitum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sectius: <entryFree id="n43248" type="main" key="secti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectĭus</orth>, v. secus <sense id="n43248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sectivus: <entryFree id="n43249" type="main" key="secti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seco</etym>, <sense id="n43249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be cut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrum,</quote> <trans><tr>cut-leek</tr>, <tr>chives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:8:3" default="NO">12, 8, 3</bibl> (also cited in <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 11</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 33, § 168</bibl>; cf. sectilis, II.</sense></entryFree>
sector: <entryFree id="n43250" type="main" key="sector1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who cuts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cuts off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cutter</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n43250.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">zonarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a cutpurse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a cutthroat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 80</bibl></cit> (v. II.); so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feni,</quote> <trans><tr>a haycutter</tr>, <tr>mower</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43250.2" n="II" level="1"> Publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">a bidder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchaser at a public sale of goods</hi> captured or confiscated by the State (cf. quadruplator): <cit><quote lang="la">sectores vocantur qui publica bona mercantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:146" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de bonis et de caede agatur, testimonium dicturus est is, qui et sector est et sicarius: hoc est, qui et illorum ipsorum bonorum, de quibus agitur, emptor atque possessor est et eum hominem occidendum curavit, de cujus morte quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sector sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeii (sc. bonorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 14, 30</bibl></cit>; Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubique hasta et sector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae subjecit tabernas, nec sector inventus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:48" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 25, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 496</bibl>; cf. Ps.-Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=52, p. 172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 52, p. 172</bibl>, and 2, 1, 23, § <cit><quote lang="la">61, p. 177 Orell.—In a double sense, with the signif. I.: nescimus per ista tempora eosdem fere sectores fuisse collorum et bonorum?</quote> <trans><tr>cutthroats and cutpurses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 80</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n43250.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc rapti pretio fasces sectorque favoris Ipse sui populus,</quote> <trans><tr>seller of his favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 178</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43250.4" n="III" level="1"> Geometrical t. t., <hi rend="ital">the sector of a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that part of a circle included between any two radii and an arc</hi>, Boëth. Art. Geom. p. 379, 13.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43251" type="main" key="sector2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sector</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n43251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> sectarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 78</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. freq. a.</hi> [sequor], <hi rend="ital">to follow continually</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, in a good or bad sense; <hi rend="ital">to run after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompany; to follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n43251.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43251.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem te jam sector quintum hunc annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum misi, qui sectari solet meum gnatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: Chrysogonum <cb n="SECU" /> (servi), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorem circum omnia fora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mercede conducti obviam candidatis issent, si conducti sectarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:32:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 32, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at sectabuntur multi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te quisquam stipator Praeter Crispinum sectabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum manus quae regem ex more sectatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 33</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 6, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres sectarier,</quote> <trans><tr>to run after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 183</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">desine matronas sectarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse suas sectatur oves, at filius agnos,</quote> <trans><tr>accompanies</tr>, <tr>guards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow the plough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: canes, <hi rend="ital">to follow the hounds</hi> (that hunt on before), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl> (4, 13), 14: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to run after</tr>, <tr>pursue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: servum, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ridicule insanus, qui ejusmodi est, ut eum pueri sectentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne scuticā dignum horribili sectere flagello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exagitet nostros Manes sectetur et umbras, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit> (2, 8 b, 19).— <hi rend="ital">To visit a place gladly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frequent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo coepit me obsecrare, Ut sibi liceret discere id de me: sectari jussi (alluding to the train of followers who accompanied the ancient philosophers),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 36</bibl>: at sectabantur multi ... Quid opus est sectatoribus? (of the train of a candidate) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43251.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunt</hi> animals: sues silvaticos in montibus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 555, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectaris apros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; 2, 2, 106; 2, 3, 13 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 6, 25: leporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 9</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cervam videre fugere, sectari canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43251.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strive after; to pursue eagerly</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Cic.): quid vos hanc miseram ac tenuem sectamini praedam? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina tironum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectantem levia nervi Deficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasia aut porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes dicendi Veneres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quas figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eminentes virtutes,</quote> <trans><tr>to seek out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumaciam sententiarum, habitum vultumque ejus,</quote> <trans><tr>to seek to imitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta salubria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriosa convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alienis eripiendis vitam sectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 2, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43251.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hunt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">track out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitte sectari, rosa quo locorum Sera moretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut omnia dicerem sectatus, sed ut maxime necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.?*! In a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vellet se a cane sectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sectorius: <entryFree id="n43252" type="hapax" key="secto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. sector, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the purchase of captured</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confiscated effects</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:146" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sectrix: <entryFree id="n43253" type="hapax" key="sectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that purchases confiscated goods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
