rend="ital">serene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">deos securum agere aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies (leti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:939" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 939</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus (Herculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia nato recepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:455" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa malorum,</quote> <trans><tr>careless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:490" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>of the careless idler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox securae claritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus securius,</quote> <trans><tr>more free from care</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">securior materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">securos ab eo metu somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 42, § 149</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota secura repulsae,</quote> <trans><tr>safe against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 199</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43283.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that frees from care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 715</bibl></cit> (securos ab effectu, Serv. ad l. l.).—</sense><sense id="n43283.6" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:3" default="NO">11, 3, 3</bibl>.—Of abstract things: castrensis jurisdictio, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">off-hand</hi> (shortly after, opp. gravis, intentus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43283.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, object., of a thing or place, <hi rend="ital">free from danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi> (not till after the Aug. period, and rare for the class. tutus): <cit><quote lang="la">hostis levis et velox et repentinus, qui nullum usquam tempus, nullum locum quietum aut securum esse sineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:62:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 62, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tripolim securissimam reddidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securiorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (hominum) ea natura est, ut secura velint,</quote> <trans><tr>safety</tr>, <tr>security</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitā inundatione Tiberis non modo jacentia et plana urbis loca sed secura ejusmodi casuum implevit,</quote> <trans><tr>secure from such accidents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in two forms, </sense><sense id="n43283.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-cūrē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n43283.9" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconcernedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">lente ac secure aliquid ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 3</bibl> (with neglegenter);<cb n="SECU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi> al.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43283.10" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Safely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">securely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43283.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcūrĭter</orth> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joan. Ep. ad Parth. Tr. 10:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joan. Ep. ad Parth. Tr. 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secus: <entryFree id="n43284" type="main" key="se^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcus</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, v. sexus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43285" type="main" key="se^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcus</orth>. <sense id="n43285.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> <etym>root seq- or secof sequor, q. v.</etym>, only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquĭor</orth>, <itype>us, ōris</itype>, <hi rend="ital">inferior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worse</hi> (only post-class.; cf. Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 3</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">in sequiorem sexum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexus sequioris fetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 249, 33; <cit><quote lang="la">8, p. 206, 7: vitae sequioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna sequior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (prop., <hi rend="ital">following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">later</hi> in rank or order, i. e. <hi rend="ital">less</hi> than something mentioned before; hence, in gen.), <hi rend="ital">otherwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">differently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not so;</hi> and esp. freq. with a negative (per litoten), <hi rend="ital">not otherwise</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">even so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just so</hi> (opp. always to what is right, correct, or proper, not to what is wrong; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 1056 sq.; for <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> forms, v. I. B. infra). </sense><sense id="n43285.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. aliter): si illuc, quod volumus, eveniet, gaudebimus: Sin secus, patiemur animis aequis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bonus est, obnoxius sum: sin secus est, faciam, uti jubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum genera esse dicuntur tamquam poëtarum. Id secus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ille est) quem dudum dixi. Hoc si secus reperies, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videsne, quod paulo ante secus tibi videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: magnum mehercule hominem, nemo dicet secus; <cit><quote lang="la">sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si ita esset... ad amicitiam esset aptissimus: quod longe secus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia longe secus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtote, quanto secus ego fecerim, Cato ap. Charis, p. 192 P.: nobis aliter videtur: recte secusne, postea,</quote> <trans><tr>whether rightly or not</tr>, <tr>right or wrong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte an secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 28, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honestis an secus amicis uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro bene aut secus consulto,</quote> <trans><tr>for good or ill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prout bene ac (al. aut) secus cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prout opportune proprieque aut secus collocata sunt (verba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(artes) utiles aut secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43285.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: secus aetatem agerem, quam illi egissent, Cato ap. Charis, p. 195 P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid fiat secus quam volumus quamque oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem sunt membra in utriusque disputatione, sed paulo secus a me atque ab illo partita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.4" n="b" level="4"> Non (nec) secus or haud secus (the latter not in Cic.), <hi rend="ital">not otherwise</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">even so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just so</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">educavit (eam) magna industria, Quasi si esset ex se nata, non multo secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fit obviam Clodio hora fere undecima aut non multo secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non multo secus fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibitur, estur, quasi in popinā, haud secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita jam quasi canes, haud secus, circumstabant navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti qui anguem pressit, etc....Haud secus Androgeos visu tremefactus abibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequam memento rebus in arduis Servare mentem, non secus in bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis in arvis movet arma leo,...Haud secus gliscit violentia Turno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec secus apud principem ad mortem aguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alaeque et auxilia cohortium neque multo secus in iis virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In negative questions: <cit><quote lang="la">dedistine ei gladium, qui se occideret?...Quid secus est aut quid interest, dare te argentum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ac</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (the latter not in Cic.: non secus ac = non aliter ac; but: non secus quam = non minus quam, Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 10</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra): numquam secus Habui illam, ac si ex me esset nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque illud quod dixi, non dixi secus ac sentiebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non secus ac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:180 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 180 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud secus ac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:236 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 236 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepit ad sese, haud secus quam si ex se simus natae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">haud secus quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8</bibl>; 8, 9 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:102 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 102 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:21" default="NO">8, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:17" default="NO">8, 11, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non secus quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 727</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 480</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec secus quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 68</bibl>: ne <pb n="1657" /> <cb n="SECU" /> secus quam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl>.—In the poets freq. non (haud) secus ac, for introducing a comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">non secus ac patriis acer Roma-nus in armis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non secus ac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 272</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 856</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non secus atque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud secus atque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 456</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 40</bibl>; cf. also without <hi rend="ital">ac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non secus in jugis stupet Evias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.6" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., otherwise than as it should be, or, than is wished, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badly</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magna consolatio est, cum recordare, etiam si secus acciderit, te, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea ipsa...secus ab eo in me ipsum facta esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in alterā re causa nihil esset quin secus judicaret ipse de se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 22</bibl>: prius omnia pati decrevit; <cit><quote lang="la">quam bellum sumere, quia temptatum antea secus cesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ubi secus procedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintus frater purgat se multum per litteras et affirmat nihil a se cuiquam de te secus esse dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui de aliquo (just before, irreligiose),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimare de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> in four forms, which are often confused in MSS. and edd.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquĭus</orth>, <itype>but with negatives or quo, eo, nihilo</itype>, etc., usu. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sētĭus</orth>, less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-cĭus</orth>; also (ante-class.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">sectĭus</orth>, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:94" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Trin. 1:2:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 93</bibl> Ritschl (v. on the authorities for these forms, Neue, Formenl. 2, 691 sq.): nisi inpediret ingeni inbecillitas Metusque me, quo setius me colligam, <hi rend="ital">so that I cannot</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus), Afran. ap. Charis, p. 195 (Com. Rel. v. 291 Rib.): impedimento est, quo setius lex feratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam in eo consistit, melius an sequius terrae mandaverit pater familias pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitus, quod sequius sit, de meis civibus loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.8" n="b" level="4"> Non (haud) setius: <cit><quote lang="la">instat non setius ac rotat ensem,</quote> <trans><tr>none the less</tr>, <tr>just as much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 441</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec setius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 781</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si servus meus esses, nihilo setius Mihi obsequiosus semper fuisti,</quote> <trans><tr>no less</tr>, <tr>just as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo setius,</quote> <trans><tr>nevertheless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo setius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo tamen setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen nihilo setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec hōc setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eo setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen eo setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nihilo mihi esse videntur sectius quam somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 57</bibl></cit>.—In negative questions: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fecimus? quid diximus tibi sequius quam velles?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43285.10" n="2" level="3"> Pregn. (v. supra, I. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed memet moror, cum hoc ago setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: sin, id quod non spero, ratio talis sequius ceciderit, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 291 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne homines de me sequius loquantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:42:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 42, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.11" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (anteclass. and late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod vulgus usurpat Secus illum sedi, hoc est secundum illum, et novum et sordidum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 61</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra sinistra foramina utrimque secus laminas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 2</bibl></cit>: ut quae secus mare essent locis regnaret, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">SECVS VIAM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3688</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 85, § 135</bibl>, the best MSS. have secundum): <cit><quote lang="la">SECVS CONIVGEM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 806, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secus viam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secus mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43285.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in proportion to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SECVS MERITA EIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 7170</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43285.13" n="3" level="3"> Affixed to a <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">side</hi>: altrinsecus, <hi rend="ital">on the other side</hi>: utrinsecus, <hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>: circumsecus, <hi rend="ital">on all sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round about.</hi></sense></entryFree>
secutio: <entryFree id="n43286" type="hapax" key="se^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sequor</etym>, <sense id="n43286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a following after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striving after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Eccl. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Eccl. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
secutor: <entryFree id="n43287" type="main" key="se^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sĕquūtor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that follows another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a follower.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43287.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acerrimum relinquens uxori secutorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>, p. 148, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">TRIBVNI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3516</bibl></cit> and 3517.—As <hi rend="ital">an appellation of Mars</hi> (with Comes), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 30</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43287.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a pursuer</hi>, a kind of <cb n="SED" /> light-armed gladiator who fought with the retiarii (pursuing them), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:210" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 210</bibl> (et Schol. ad loc.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2571</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2572</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2583</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 55</bibl>; and Friedlaender in Neues Rhein. Mus. 10, p. 585.</sense></entryFree>
secutorius: <entryFree id="n43288" type="main" key="se^cu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sequor</etym>, <sense id="n43288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">following</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:166" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:169" default="NO">169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
secutrix: <entryFree id="n43289" type="main" key="se^cu_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>secutor</etym>, <sense id="n43289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a follower</hi> (late Lat.), Inc. Assum. Mar. 7.</sense></entryFree>
secutuleius: <entryFree id="n43290" type="hapax" key="se^cu_tu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcūtŭlēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sequor</etym>, <sense id="n43290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that follows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">runs after others</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier secutuleia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a street-walker</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 81, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sed: <entryFree id="n43291" type="main" key="se^d1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕd</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕt</orth>, <sense id="n43291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [cf. Freund, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:page=8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. p. 8 sq.</bibl>; old and orig. form sedum, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 87</bibl> P., and Mar. Vict. p. 2458 P.; but more prob. an ablative from root of the reflexive pron. so- for suo-, and orig. the same with the insep. prep. 2. sēd; prop., by itself, apart; hence, but, only, etc.; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, p. 200 sq.], a particle of limitation, exception, or correction (cf. at and autem <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n43291.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum regale genus civitatis reliquis simplicibus longe anteponendum: sed ita, quoad statum suum retinet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neoptolemus apud Ennium Philosophari sibi ait necesse esse, sed paucis: nam omnino haud placere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Memmius perfectus litteris, sed Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 70, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nactus es (me otiosum), sed mehercule otiosiorem operā quam animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae observanda essent, multa constituit (Numa), sed ea sine impensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miser homo est, qui, etc....sed ille miserior qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera dico, sed nequicquam, quoniam non vis credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video te testimoniis satis instructum: sed apud me argumenta plus quam testes valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Platonis civitatem) praeclaram illam quidem fortasse, sed a vitā hominum abhorrentem et moribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed id ubi jam penes sese habent, ex bonis pessumi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri casus plus honoris habuerunt quam laboris, etc....Sed si aliter ut dixi accidisset: qui possem queri? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istos captivos sinito ambulare, si foris, si intus volent. Sed uti asserventur magnā diligentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum dicere...sed neque his contentus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 36</bibl></cit>: nec sum in ullā re molestus civitatibus; <cit><quote lang="la">sed fortasse tibi, qui haec praedicem de me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum tantopere admiratus, sed posteaquam coepit rationem exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non perfectum illud quidem, sed tolerabile est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sane bonum rei publicae genus, sed tamen inclinatum et quasi pronum ad perniciosissimum statum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio tibi ita placere: sed tamen velim scire, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile factu est, sed conabor tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo defuit fortasse ratio, sed tamen vincit ipsa natura saepe rationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33, 57</bibl></cit>: illa quidem tristis, nec adhuc interrita vultu: Sed regina tamen, sed opaci maxima mundi; <cit><quote lang="la">Sed tamen inferni pollens matrona tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:507 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 507 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:718" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 718</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique patriae, sed omnes famā atque fortunis expertes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum quidem regem assecutus non est, sed magnam partem agminis oppresserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus aegri ex abitu viri quam ex adventu voluptatis cepi. Sed hoc me beat saltem, quod perduelles vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apponam urnam jam ego hanc in mediā viā. Sed autem, quid si hanc hinc abstulerit quispiam?</quote> <trans><tr>but then</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit> (cf. in the foll. II. A. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">statim Luculli ... eum domum suam receperunt. Sed enim hoc non solum ingenii ac litterarum, verum etiam naturae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>but indeed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progeniem sed enim Trojano a sanguine duci Audierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 164</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 395</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 28 et saep. (cf. also infra, II. A. 2.): sed enimvero, cum detestabilis altera res sit, quid ad deliberationem dubii superesse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 14</bibl></cit>.—Very rarely with <hi rend="ital">non</hi> (for nec tamen), introducing a qualification of a previous word: <cit><quote lang="la">Academici veteres beatum quidem esse etiam inter hos cruciatus fatentur, sed non ad perfectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n43291.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43291.3" n="A" level="2"> Interrupting the <cb n="SED" /> discourse by transition to another subject or by ending the speech. </sense><sense id="n43291.4" n="1" level="3"> In a transition to another subject: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis sit (servus), si eri sint tristes: hilarus sit, si gaudeant. Set age, responde: jam vos redistis in gratiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 1, 26: non impedio, praesertim quoniam feriati sumus. Sed possumus audire aliquid, an serius venimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc reliquorum oratorum aetates et gradus persequamur. Curio fuit igitur ejusdem aetatis fere, etc. ... Scripsit etiam alia nonnulla, etc.... Sed ecce in manibus vir praestantissimo ingenio... C. Gracchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 33, 125</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eccum Amphitruonem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid ego cesso?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: sed ista mox; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc audiamus Philum, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—In recurring to a previous subject: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ad instituta redeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:61:220" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 61, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed redeamus rursus ad Hortensium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 84, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam ad id, unde degressi sumus, revertamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed perge de Caesare et redde quae restant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 74, 258</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, after parenthetic clauses, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I say</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem cum audio socrum meam Laeliam (facilius enim mulieres incorruptam antiquitatem conservant, quod multorum sermonis expertes ea tenent semper quae prima didicerunt) sed eam sic audio, ut Plautum mihi aut Naevium videar audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Pompeius) ut peroravit (nam in eo sane fortis fuit: non est deterritus: dixit omnia, atque interdum etiam silentio, cum auctoritate semper), sed ut peroravit, surrexit Clodius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43291.5" n="2" level="3"> In breaking off, discontinuing speech: <cit><quote lang="la">sed satis verborum est: cura quae jussi atque abi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, si placet, in hunc diem hactenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 44, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec hactenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:140 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 140 al.</bibl></cit>: sed quid ego haec memoro? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 724</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 318 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec requievit enim, donec Calchante ministro—Sed quid ego haec autem nequicquam ingrata revolvo? Quidve moror?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 101</bibl></cit>: sed enim, <foreign lang="greek">oi)konomi/a</foreign> (epistulae) si perturbatior est, tibi assignato: te enim sequor, <foreign lang="greek">sxedia/zonta,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">but indeed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sed enim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43291.6" n="B" level="2"> After negative clauses, to limit the negative statement, i. e. to indicate either that the assertion does not hold good at all, but something else does instead; or else that it is not exclusively true, but something else holds good in addition, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary;</hi> and in an ascending signif., <hi rend="ital">but also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but in fact</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n43291.7" n="1" level="3"> In a simple opposition: non cauponantes bellum, sed belligerantes, Ferro, non auro, vitam cernamus utrique, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 201 Vahl.); cf.: haud doctis dictis certantes, sed maledictis ...Non ex jure manu consertum sed magi' ferro Rem repetunt, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 274 sq. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non ego erus tibi, sed servus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (hominum vestigia) ille (Aristippus) non ex agri consiturā, sed ex doctrinae indiciis interpretabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec leges imponit populo, quibus ipse non pareat, sed suam vitam, ut legem, praefert suis civibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 13, 19: neque hac nos patria lege genuit, ut...sed ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quod...sed quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non liberis servitutem, sed contra servientibus libertatem afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">Several times repeated: non sibi se soli natum, sed patriae, sed suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non naturā exoriatur, sed judicio, sed opinione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed publicam, sed ob frumentum decretam, sed a publicanis faenore acceptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:72:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 72, § 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eros nec dominos appellat eos ...sed patriae custodes, sed patres et deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:44 sq" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 44 sq.</bibl>: quam tibi non Perseus, verum si quaeris, ademit; <cit><quote lang="la">Sed grave Nereïdum numen, sed corniger Hammon, Sed quae visceribus veniebat belua ponti Exsaturanda meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed Pompeium, sed Lepidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:7:3" default="NO">1, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praefectum ab iis, sed Germanicum ducem, sed Tiberium imperatorem violari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43291.8" n="2" level="3"> In a climax. <pb n="1658" /> <cb n="SED" /> </sense><sense id="n43291.9" n="a" level="4">Non modo (solum, tantum, etc.)...sed or sed etiam (et, quoque), <hi rend="ital">not only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not merely ...but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but indeed</hi> (sed, standing alone, isolates the ascending idea, while an appended <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quoque</hi> places it in closer connection with the first statement, and thus permits them to be viewed together): <cit><quote lang="la">non modo falsum illud esse, sed hoc verissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 44, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non modo singulis hominibus, sed potentissimis populis saepe contingit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 10, 17: id ei perpetuā oratione contigit, non modo ut acclamatione, sed ut convitio et maledictis impediretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius viri consilio non solum ortum novum populum, sed adultum jam et paene puberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero corpori soli subveniendum est, sed menti atque animo multo magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo ut in scaenā, sic in foro non eos modo laudari, qui celeri motu utantur, sed eos etiam, quos statarios appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ejus non facta solum, sed etiam dicta meminisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum fictum, sed etiam imperite absurdeque fictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>; 1, 3, 4; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 34, 51: neque vero se populo solum, sed etiam senatui commisit, neque senatui modo, sed etiam publicis praesidiis et armis, neque his tantum, verum ejus potestati, cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec non delata solum, sed paene credita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi soli versatur ante oculos, sed etiam posteris erit clara et insignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum non modo favisse sed et tantam illi pecuniam dedisse honoris mei causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes civiles dissensiones, neque solum eas, quas audistis, sed et has, quas vosmet ipsi meministis et vidistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplicatusque terror non infimis solum, sed primoribus patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non responsum solum benigne legatis est, sed Philippi quoque filius Demetrius ad patrem reducendus legatis datus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciti per haec non modo Cherusci, sed conterminae gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via non angusta modo, sed plerumque praerupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:20" default="NO">5, 1, 20</bibl> Mützell ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n43291.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., in passing from the part to the whole, from the particular to the universal (usually followed by omnino, or by omnis, cunctus, totus, universus, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">timebat non ea solum quae timenda erant, sed omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegere, quid de se quisque sentiat, non solum arrogantis est, sed etiam omnino dissoluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sibi tantum, sed universis singulisque consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non consuli modo, sed omnibus civibus enitendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non initio tantum, sed continuo totius temporis successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo Italiā, sed toto orbe terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—Etiam is rarely added: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens non modo ductores nostri, sed universi etiam exercitus ad mortem concurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43291.11" n="b" level="4"> Non modo (solum) non...sed, sed etiam; sed ne... quidem, <hi rend="ital">not only not...but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but not even</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non modo a mente non deserar, sed id ipsum doleam, me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicetur non verbo, sed re non modo non consul, sed etiam hostis Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc non modo non laudari, sed ne concedi quidem potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis non modo non laudi, verum etiam vitio dandum puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo non oppugnator, sed etiam defensor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego contra ostendo, non modo nihil eorum fecisse Sex. Roscium, sed ne potuisse quidem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 79</bibl></cit>.—Also, without the second <hi rend="ital">non</hi> in the first clause, and with <hi rend="ital">ne quidem</hi>, doubly negative (only when both clauses have the same verb; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Zumpt, Gram. § 724 b): quod mihi non modo irasci, sed ne dolere quidem impune licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea est ratio instructarum navium, ut non modo plures, sed ne singuli quidem possint accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:51:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 51, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo aeternam, sed ne diuturnam quidem gloriam assequi possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:21:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 21, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea sunt demum non ferenda in mendacio, quae non solum facta esse, sed ne fieri quidem potuisse cernimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non modo amico, sed ne libero quidem digna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: non modo facere, sed ne cogitare<cb n="SEDE" />  quidem quicquam audebit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 19, 77</bibl>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">vix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum haec genera virtutum non solum in moribus nostris, sed vix jam in libris reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo ad expeditiones, sed vix ad quietas stationes viribus sufficiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—After <hi rend="ital">quisquam</hi> with ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">non</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non modo praedandi causā quisquam ex agro Romano exiret, sed ultro Fidenates descenderent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 21, 6</bibl></cit> (where Weissenb. supplies <hi rend="ital">non</hi> in brackets before exiret); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui non solum erant urbes contenti cingere muris, verum etiam loca aspera et confragosa saxis eligebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. Limit. p. 197" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. Limit. p. 197</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43291.12" n="C" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>, after <hi rend="ital">non modo</hi>, acquires an idea of ascent or climax, from the fact that <hi rend="ital">non modo</hi> represents a thing as existing (only not existing alone), and thus includes an affirmation, so, too, after purely affirmative clauses, <hi rend="ital">sed</hi> sometimes serves as an ascending adjunct, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but in fact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te hodie reddam madidum, sed vino, probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odore canibus anum, sed multo, replent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:17:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Dae.</hi> Curriculo affer Duas clavas. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Clavas? <hi rend="ital">Dae.</hi> Sed probas: <cit><quote lang="la">propera cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—In good prose usually joined with <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">et</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">hic mihi primum meum consilium defuit, sed etiam obfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl>, c, 10; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 16, 6: Q. Volusium, certum hominem, sed mirifice etiam abstinentem, misi in Cyprum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc in genere si eum adjuveris, apud ipsum praeclarissime posueris, sed mihi etiam gratissimum feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 64, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex testamento Tiberii, sed et Liviae Augustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43292" type="main" key="se_d2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēd</orth> = sine, v. sine <sense id="n43292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> and 2. se.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n43293" type="main" key="se_d3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēd</orth> = se; cf. the letter D.</entryFree>
sedamen: <entryFree id="n43294" type="hapax" key="se_da_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sedo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of allaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an allayment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali (mors),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1188" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sedate: <entryFree id="n43295" type="main" key="se_da_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sedo, <sense id="n43295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sedatio: <entryFree id="n43296" type="main" key="se_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sedo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an allaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calming</hi> of the passions (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">perturbationum animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sedator: <entryFree id="n43297" type="hapax" key="se_da_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an allayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quieter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris insaniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sedatus: <entryFree id="n43298" type="main" key="se_da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sedo.</entryFree>
sedda: <entryFree id="n43299" type="gloss" key="sedda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sedda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sella <sense id="n43299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sedecennis: <entryFree id="n43300" type="hapax" key="se_de^cennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdĕcennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sedecim-annus</etym>, <sense id="n43300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sixteen years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 32</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sedecies: <entryFree id="n43301" type="hapax" key="se_de^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-dĕcĭes</orth>, <sense id="n43301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [sex-decies], <hi rend="ital">sixteen times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedecies ad eorum filios sedecies computatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Claud. Itin. 1, 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sedecim: <entryFree id="n43302" type="main" key="se_de^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdĕcim</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexdĕcim</orth>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>sex-decem</etym>, <sense id="n43302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sixteen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:103 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 103 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexdecim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 16, 3</bibl> (separately, decem et sex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 31, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 40</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
sedecula: <entryFree id="n43303" type="main" key="se_de_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sedes</etym>, <sense id="n43303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a low stool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl>.—Collat. form: <cit><quote lang="la">sediculum sedile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sedentarius: <entryFree id="n43304" type="main" key="se^denta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n43304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedentary</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sutores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: necessitas assentiendi, <hi rend="ital">of giving assent while sitting</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without rising to make a speech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:73:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 73, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigatio,</quote> <trans><tr>fatigue from sitting</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sedeo: <entryFree id="n43305" type="main" key="se^deo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdeo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, sessum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root sad-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(e*d,</foreign> to sit; cf. <foreign lang="greek">e+dos, e+zomai;</foreign> Lat. sedes, insidiae, sedare, sella, etc.; Engl. sit, seat</etym>, <sense id="n43305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43305.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very freq. in prose and poetry); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case>, or with other <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">advv. of place.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43305.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n43305.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi stant ambo, non sedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sit, quod cum tot summi oratores sedeant, ego potissimum surrexerim,</quote> <trans><tr>remain sitting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedens iis assensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumbi sedendo dolent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex ille sedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 37.—</sense><sense id="n43305.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in subselliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedilibus in primis eques sedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proscaenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: aliquem in XIIII. sessum deducere, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl> (v. quattuordecim): malo in illā <cb n="SEDE" /> tuā sedeculā sedere quam in istorum sella curuli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in saxo (ejecti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arā (mulieres supplices),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in leone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>; and with a <hi rend="ital">gen. specification</hi> of the place where: <cit><quote lang="la">in conclavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hemicyclio domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubo in culmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix in humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musca in temone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43305.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With simple <case>abl.</case> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">bis sex caelestes, medio Jove, sedibus altis sedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:650" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 650</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 261: sede regiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburneis sellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sellā curuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:471" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:38:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104:14" default="NO">11, 104, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dorso aselli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:749" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae viridi solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recessu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 177</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 497</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43305.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With other <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">advv. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter ancillas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 452</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tumulum supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Jove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducis sub pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post me gradu uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:28:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 28, 32</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 522, 30</bibl>) et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sedeo istic, vos sedete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43305.7" n="2" level="3"> Late Lat., <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">to be ridden</hi> (cf. Engl. to sit a horse): <cit><quote lang="la">sederi equos in civitatibus non sivit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cod.
