Th. 9, 30, 3: cum (Bucephalus) ab equario suo mollius sederetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia sedentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43305.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43305.9" n="1" level="3"> Of magistrates, esp. of judges, <hi rend="ital">to sit in council</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in court</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">on the bench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Scaevolā tribuno) in Rostris sedente suasit Serviliam legem Crassus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 43, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus igitur mortis sedetis ultores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 29, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 37, 103 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si idcirco sedetis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 153</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius, ne ejus rei causā sedisse videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedissem forsitan unus De centum judex in tua verba viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minos arbiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit> (4, 18), 27; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedeo pro tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 1:10:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: a quibus si qui quaereret, sedissentne judices in Q. Fabricium, sedisse se dicerent, Cic Clu. 38, 105; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Rab. Post. 5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 5, 10</bibl>.—Also of the assistants of the judges: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis in tribunali Q. Pompeii praetoris urbani sedentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 12</bibl>.—In Quint., also of the advocate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:132" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 132</bibl>.—Of witnesses: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendo contra reum, cum quo sederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 32</bibl></cit>.—Of a presiding officer: <cit><quote lang="la">sedente Claudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of augurs sitting to wait for an augurium: <cit><quote lang="la">sed secundum augures sedere est augurium captare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 56</bibl>; Interp. Mai ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 241</bibl>; Fest. s. v. silentio, p. 248, a Müll.; cf. Becker, Antiq. 2, 3, p. 76.—</sense><sense id="n43305.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To continue sitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sit still; to continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi> in a place; and with an implication of inactivity, <hi rend="ital">to sit idly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be inactive; to linger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loiter</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">isdem consulibus sedentibus atque inspectantibus lata lex est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 15, 33</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri, qui in oppido sederent, quam qui rura colerent, desidiosiores putabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: quasi claudus sutor domi sedet totos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">an sedere oportuit Domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis ventis istinc navigatur, qui si essent, nos Corcyrae non sederemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quor sedebas in foro, si eras coquos Tu solus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in villā totos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum argentarias cottidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedemus desides domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit congredi quam cum tantis copiis refugere aut tam diu uno loco sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cuivis contingit adire Corinthum. Sedit qui timuit, ne non succederet,</quote> <trans><tr>sat still</tr>, <tr>stayed at home</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 37</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of waiting on an oracle or a god for an answer or for aid (= Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i+zein</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ante sacras fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius ad tumulum fugiam supplexque sedebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos ad mea busta sedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit> (4, 15), 24: <cit><quote lang="la">meliora deos sedet omina poscens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 456</bibl></cit>; so of a lover at the door of his mistress: me retinent victum formosae vincla puellae, Et sedeo janitor, Tib. <pb n="1659" /> <cb n="SEDE" /> 1, 1, 56: <cit><quote lang="la">et frustra credula turba sedet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43305.11" n="b" level="4"> Of long, esp. of inactive encamping in war, <hi rend="ital">to sit</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to remain encamped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep the field</hi>, before an enemy's fortress or army: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium copiae magnae contra me sedebant, Cato ap. Charis, p. 197 P.: septimum decimum annum Ilico sedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum apud hostes sedimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedendo expugnare urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedendo et cunctando bellum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quieto sedente rege ad Enipeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Suessulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 44</bibl>; 10, 25; 22, 39; 23, 19; 44, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 440</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud moenia Contrebiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">compressis, quod aiunt, manibus sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus proverbium est, Romanus sedendo vincit (prob. originating with Q. Fabius Cunctator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43305.12" n="3" level="3"> For desideo (2.), <hi rend="ital">to sit at stool</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 29</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sordido in loco sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:13:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43305.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (in prose not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n43305.14" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settle down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pondere libra Prona nec hac plus parte sedet nec surgit ab illā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque tam fuerunt gravia, ut depressa sederent, Nec levia, ut possent per summas labier oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 474</bibl></cit>; cf.: flamma petit altum; propior locus aëra cepit; <cit><quote lang="la">Sederunt medio terra fretumque solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:110" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1,110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedet nebula densior campo quam montibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedet vox auribus,</quote> <trans><tr>sinks into</tr>, <tr>penetrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: rupti aliqui montes tumulique sedere, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 14, 1, 2</bibl> (H. 2, 43 Dietsch); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedisse immensos montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: memor illius escae, Quae simplex olim sibi sederit, <hi rend="ital">sat well upon your stomach</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">agreed well with you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:94" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43305.15" n="2" level="3"> Of feelings, passions, etc.: his dictis sedere minae, <hi rend="ital">subsided</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">were quieted</hi>, = sedatae sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:624" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 624</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam irae: sedit rabies feritasque famesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:823" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 823</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43305.16" n="3" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to lie low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in the valley</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campo Nola sedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:162" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediisque sedent convallibus arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 380</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:330" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 330</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca sedens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lower</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 9</bibl></cit> ( = sessilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 47, 8</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n43305.17" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to sit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sit close</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hang fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovable; be settled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">established</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus fuit, quo navit in undis, Nunc sedet Ortygie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liquido sederunt ossa cerebro,</quote> <trans><tr>stuck fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 289</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of weapons, etc., that sink deep: clava (Herculis), adversi sedit in ore viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:576" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Scaevae) in scuto centum atque viginti tela sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:40" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librata cum sederit (glans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29</bibl></cit>; hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also, of deep-seated wounds: plagam sedere Cedendo arcebat, <hi rend="ital">from sinking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">penetrating deeply</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta sedent vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—Of clothes, <hi rend="ital">to fit</hi> (opp. dissidere, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 96</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ita et sedet melius et continetur (pars togae),</quote> <trans><tr>sits better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 140 sq.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">toga umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 161</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam bene umeris tuis sederet imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:10:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of vessels: <cit><quote lang="la">sicco jam litore sedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves super aggerationem, quae fuerat sub aquā, sederent,</quote> <trans><tr>stuck fast</tr>, <tr>grounded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus laetissima facies et amabilis vultus in omnium civium ore, oculis, animo sedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:10" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid fideliter in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum Polynicis amati Nomen in ore sedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:114" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 114</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Cressa relicta in ingenio tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere coepit sententia haec,</quote> <trans><tr>to be established</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc parum mihi sedet judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 46:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 46, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 2, 5</bibl>. —Hence, also of any thing <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolved</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">determined upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi non animo fixum immotumque sederet, Ne cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">idque pio sedet Aeneae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:352" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 352</bibl></cit>. —With a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc sedet Ferre iter impavidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:324" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuo petere omina caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegaei scopulos habitare profundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:383" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 383</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sedes: <entryFree id="n43306" type="main" key="se_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n43306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sedum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 20</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 771</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedium, from form sedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:109:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 109, 3</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sedeo, q. v.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a seat</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n43306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that on which one sits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bench</hi>, <cb n="SEDE" /> <hi rend="ital">chair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throne</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n43306.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis sedibus, quae erant sub platano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sedes honoris, sella curulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes honoris sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros (senatores) in sedibus suis trucidatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: in sedes collocat se regias, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 31</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positis sedibus consederunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis sex caelestes, medio Jove, sedibus altis sedent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">media inter deos sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in saxo frigida sedi, Quamque lapis sedes, tam lapis ipsa fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 50</bibl></cit>.—In the <number>plur.</number> also of the seat of a single person: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi concedo meas sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, II. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: non si priores Maeonius tenet Sedes Homerus, <hi rend="ital">the foremost seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first rank</hi> (the fig. borrowed from the rows of seats in the theatre), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43306.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in the elder Pliny, <hi rend="ital">the seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fundament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:143" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 70, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:75" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 3, 37, § 75</bibl>; 23, 4, 41, § 83; 26, 8, 58, § 90; 32, 9, 33, § 104.— </sense><sense id="n43306.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., of a place where one stays, <hi rend="ital">a seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">residence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temple</hi>, etc. (the prevailing signif.; syn.: domicilium, locus, habitatio). </sense><sense id="n43306.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (used alike of the residence of one or more persons): <cit><quote lang="la">hi coetus (hominum) hac, de quā exposui, causā instituti sedem primum certo loco domiciliorum causā constituerunt, quam cum locis manuque sepsissent, ejusmodi conjunctionem tectorum oppidum vel urbem appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentio te sedem etiam nunc hominum ac domum contemplari (i. e. terram),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 19, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hanc sedem et aeternam domum contueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hanc sedem et domum suam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 25, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eam sibi domum sedemque delegit, in quā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 66, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec domus, haec sedes, haec sunt penetralia magni Amnis (sc. Penei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni sede ac loco ferrum flammamque metuemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 85</bibl></cit>; so (with locus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec veni, nisi fata locum sedemque dedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum actum esse praecipitem in sceleratorum sedem atque regionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:61:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 61, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiā bellum gerimus, in sede ac solo nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res Trojanis spem adfirmat tandem stabili certāque sede finiendi erroris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crematā patriā domo profugos sedem quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 16, 13</bibl>; 39, 54, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 38, 4: Orestis liberi sedem cepere circa Lesbum insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra hos Chatti initium sedis ab Hercynio saltu incohant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo Graecis ultro bellum inferebamus: nunc in sedibus nostris propulsamus illatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non motam Termini sedem (just before: in Termini fano),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Juppiter O. M. suam sedem atque arcem populi Romani in re trepidā tutatus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim regis praetorium petunt, in ipsius potissimum sede morituri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ulmus) nota quae sedes fuerat columbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes scelerata, for sceleratorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 456</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibur Sit meae sedes utinam senectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia diversa nequicquam sede locuti,</quote> <trans><tr>place</tr>, <tr>spot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43306.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (in good prose usually only of the dwellings of several): <cit><quote lang="la">qui incolunt eas urbes non haerent in suis sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum domicilia, sedes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Galli) aliud domicilium, alias sedes petant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes habere in Galliā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reverti se in suas sedes regionesque simulaverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae gens ad hoc tempus iis sedibus se continet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas ipsi sedes ab se auctae multitudini addiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui profugi sedibus incertis vagabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(deūm) sedes nostris sedibus esse Dissimiles debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 153</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">divum, deum sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1188" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 34</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes sanctae penatium deorumque larumque familiarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos ipsos convulsos ex sedibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discretae piorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia ad assuetas sibi sedes revertuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of the dwelling of a single person (cf. supra, I. A.): cur (Juppiter) suas Discutit infesto praeclaras<cb n="SEDI" />  fulmine sedes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 418</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Demaratus) in eā civitate domicilium et sedes collocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immissum esse ab eo C. Cornelium, qui me in sedibus meis trucidaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrias age desere sedes, i. e. patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneam in Siciliam quaerentem sedes delatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43306.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n43306.8" n="1" level="3"> Of the abode of the dead, <hi rend="ital">a burial-place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita Augustum in foro potius quam in Campo Martis sede destinatā cremari vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedibus ut saltem placidis in morte quiescam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 371</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 152</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43306.9" n="2" level="3"> Of the home of the soul, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima de sede volens Exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:788" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 788</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43306.10" n="C" level="2"> In relation to inanimate subjects, that upon which any thing sits fast or rests, <hi rend="ital">a seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bottom</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n43306.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc urbem (Romam) sedem aliquando et domum summo esse imperio praebituram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes caeduntur sedemque trabibus cavatae praebere coguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 38, 38, § 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia in superciliis sedem habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num montes moliri sede suā paramus?</quote> <trans><tr>to push from their place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athon Pindumve revulsos Sede suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam pulsam sede suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas mentem e suā sede et statu demovet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit> (v. also in the foll. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): ita mihi salvam ac sospitem rempublicam sistere in suā sede liceat, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deus haec fortasse benigna Reducet in sedem vice,</quote> <trans><tr>to its former state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 8</bibl></cit>: Veios an Fidenas sedem belli caperent, <hi rend="ital">the seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scene of war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">belli (bello),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 44, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 74, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; 2, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaritatis sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque verba sedem habere possunt, si rem subtraxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus quibusdam videntur in prooemio atque in epilogo sedem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 51</bibl></cit> (cf. in the foll. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">haec est sedes orationis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut de sede secundā Cederet aut quartā (iambus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sola ponatur in summi boni sede (voluptas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mens mihi nec color Certā sede manent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of the site on which a city formerly stood: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustissima sedes Assyriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā sede, quam Palaetyron ipsi vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43306.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni Capuae in sedibus luxuriosis collocati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam fracta ossa in suis sedibus remanent, etc.... fragmenta in suas sedes reponenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus in antiquas redeunt primordia sedes Ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 871</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1041" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1041</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum solidis etiamnum sedibus astas,</quote> <trans><tr>on firm ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi ipsa Roma prope convulsa sedibus suis visa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim convellimus altis Sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totamque a sedibus urbem Eruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrabantur urbium sedes, Lyrnessi et Thebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tot gentium excita sedibus suis moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totum (mare) a sedibus imis Eurusque Notusque ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 63</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 20</bibl></cit> (corresp. to loci); 5, 12, 17.</sense></entryFree>
sedibilis:
<entryFree id="n43307" type="main" key="se^di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sedeo, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n43307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">capable of being sat upon</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 1, 1</bibl>.
(† <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>sedile</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll.; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 54</bibl> ib. this word is correctly formed, but not in use.)</sense></entryFree>
sedigitus: <entryFree id="n43308" type="main" key="Se_di^gi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēdĭgĭtus</orth>, <itype>a</itype> <etym>sex-digitus, six-fingered, having six fingers on one hand, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 43, 99, § 244</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n43308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi> given to the poet C. Volcatius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:24:1" default="NO">15, 24, 1</bibl>; cf. Anth. Lat. 140 Meyer.</sense></entryFree>
sedile: <entryFree id="n43309" type="main" key="se^di_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n43309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chair</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; syn.: sella, scamnum); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra senex posito jussit relevare sedili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 639</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Med. Fac. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in sedili suo tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, of the seats in a theatre: <cit><quote lang="la">sedilibus magnus in primis eques sedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spissa nimis complere sedilia flatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 205</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lignea in Campo Martio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>.—Of other seats, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 350</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">factaque de vivo pressere sedilia saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1660" /> <cb n="SEDI" /> 317: <cit><quote lang="la">e marmore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 40</bibl></cit>.—Of the rowers' <hi rend="ital">banks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">benches</hi> in a vessel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 837</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43309.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sitting still</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post iter primum sedile, deinde unctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum adstringit labor, sedile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sedimen: <entryFree id="n43310" type="main" key="se^di^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdĭmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n43310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">settlings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sediment</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:64" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:10:108" default="NO">5, 10, 108</bibl>; cf. sedimentum.</sense></entryFree>
sedimentum: <entryFree id="n43311" type="hapax" key="se^di^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdĭmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a settling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinking down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsidence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molis (sc. obelisci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 10, 15, § 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seditio: <entryFree id="n43312" type="main" key="se_di^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sed, i. e. sine (v. h. v.), and itio; thus, orig., a going aside, going apart; hence</etym>, <sense id="n43312.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an insurrectionary separation</hi> (political or military); <hi rend="ital">dissension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civil discord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insurrection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutiny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedition</hi> (very freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: secessio, defectus): ea dissensio civium, quod seorsum eunt alii ad alios, seditio dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 149</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 25, 6</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">duobus tribunis plebis per seditionem creatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui in seditione non alterius utrius partis fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua seditio oriretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditione factā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem inter Poenos et Siculos milites esse factam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio inter belli pacisque auctores orta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem ac discordiam concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coeptare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 81</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno in populo cum saepe coörta est Seditio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditione potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 340</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hominem seditiosum defenderet, non dubitavit seditiones ipsas ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 48, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl> et saep.—Seditio, personified as <hi rend="ital">one of the attendants of Fama</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43312.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">dissension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarrel</hi> (very rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in Cic. only as a transl. of the Greek <foreign lang="greek">sta/sis</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitruo uxori turbas conciet ...tum meus pater Eam seditionem in tranquillum conferet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homini adulescentulo Filiam darem in seditionem atque in incertas nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui studeat, deus omnis habet, crescitque favore Turbida seditio, donec Juppiter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 426</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">domestica (opp. fraterna concordia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantomimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illaudata (with magno certatur amore),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 226</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43312.2" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate and abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio maris,</quote> <trans><tr>uproar</tr>, <tr>turbulence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:142" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammasque rebelles Seditione tori (Eteoclis et Polynicis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 12</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem facit lien, occupat praecordia,</quote> <trans><tr>rebels</tr>, <tr>and takes possession of my stomach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archytas iracundiam, videlicet dissidentem a ratione, seditionem quandam animi vere ducebat, et eam consilio sedari volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seditiose: <entryFree id="n43313" type="main" key="se_di^ti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdĭtĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. seditiosus <sense id="n43313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
seditiosus: <entryFree id="n43314" type="main" key="se_di^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seditio</etym>. <sense id="n43314.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of civil discord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turbulent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutinous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seditious</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: tumnltuosus, turbulentus): adhortari adulescentes, ut turbulenti, ut seditiosi, ut perniciosi cives velint esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosus et turbulentus civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pro republicā seditiosum civem toties compescuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosi tribuni plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">triumviri seditiosissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70</bibl>.—Esp. of language: <cit><quote lang="la">in summam invidiain contionibus cum cottidianis seditiosis et turbulentis adduxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosa atque improba oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosissima oratio, Auct. B. Afr. 28, 2: seditiosae voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosis vocibus regem increpare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:12" default="NO">10, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosior contio (Q. Pompeii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Mil. 17:45, p. 49" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Mil. 17, 45, p. 49</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatus L. Saturnini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43314.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43314.2" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">quarrelsome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illam (Clodiam) odi. Ea est enim seditiosa: ea cum viro bellum gerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43314.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Exposed to</hi> <cb n="SEDU" /> <hi rend="ital">discord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troubled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosa ac tumultuosa vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdĭtĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">seditiously</hi> (acc. to I.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sedo: <entryFree id="n43315" type="main" key="se_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sedeo</etym>. <sense id="n43315.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (orig. to cause to sit, to seat; hence, of inanimate or abstract objects), <hi rend="ital">to allay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">mitigo, mulceo, lenio): cave putes, aut mare ullum aut flammam esse tantam, quam non facilius sit sedare quam effrenatam insolentiā multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curriculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 125</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to furl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4) 21, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 18, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 117</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedatis fluctibus,</quote> <trans><tr>having subsided</tr>, <tr>abated</tr>, <tr>lulled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedatis ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 349</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas sedatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>.—Of hunger, thirst, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <trans><tr>to slake</tr>, <tr>quench</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 663</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:850" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 850</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 415</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem ac sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 54, 119, § 284</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carne jejunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumorem vulnerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:211" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 20, 81, § 211</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabiem, pruritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 41, § 121</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(populi impetus) aliquando incenditur, et saepe sedatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum intestinum ac domesticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 106</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 15 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam et infamiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sermunculum omnem aut restinxerit aut sedarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatem, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 24: mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 46</bibl></cit>.—Of feelings, passions, appetites, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in animis hominum motum dicendo vel excitare vel sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes (opp. excitare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">appetitus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illā tertiā parte animi, in quā irarum exsistit ardor, sedatā atque restinctā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 31: <cit><quote lang="la">curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:514" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:11:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 11, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—Rarely with personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">affert potionem et te sedatum it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vix a magistratibus juventus sedaretur,</quote> <trans><tr>was quieted</tr>, <tr>brought to order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultuantes deinde milites ipse sedavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n43315.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subside</hi>: postquam tempestas sedavit, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 6</bibl> (cf. the mid.: sedatur tempestas, supra).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">composed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alter (Herodotus) sine ullis salebris quasi sedatus amnis fluit, alter (Thucydides) incitatior fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsis numeris sedatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedatissimā et depressissimā voce uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: Terenti, Latinā voce Menandrum sedatis vocibus effers, <hi rend="ital">in gentle tones</hi>, Cic. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oderunt Sedatum celeres, agilem gnavumque remissi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere sedatiore animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: olli sedato respondit corde Latinus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedato gradu in castra abeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedatius tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 37, 103</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">calmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedately</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 20, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 92</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seduco: <entryFree id="n43316" type="main" key="se_du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n43316.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lead aside</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to draw aside; to lead away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off; to set aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put by</hi>, etc. (syn. sevoco). </sense><sense id="n43316.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">te huc foras seduxi, Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pamphilus me solum seducit foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me rursus seducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem solum seorsum ab aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem paululum a turbā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulos separatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem blandā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in secretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 11 al.</bibl></cit>— <cb n="SEDU" /> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prehendit dextram, seducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod a te seductus est tuoque beneficio adhuc vivit,</quote> <trans><tr>was withdrawn</tr>, <tr>taken out of the way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a debitā peste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocellos,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn away</tr>, <tr>avert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of abstract subjects: et dum avaritia seducere aliquid cupit atque in suum vertere, omnia fecit aliena,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 38</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43316.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43316.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, etc. (not ante-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam a corporibus seductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potes (Helvia) ad obtinendum dolorem muliebre nomen praetendere, ex quo te virtutes tuae seduxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have removed</tr>, <tr>separated you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuos ocellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43316.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to lead astray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mislead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduce</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Johan. 29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tract. in Johan. 29</bibl>; id. Civ. Dei, 14, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 22, 16</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43316.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tc. put asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: secerno, sejungo): seducit terras haec brevis unda duas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 142</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">immensos recessus (Caspia claustra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarto seducunt castra volatu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>divide into two adverse squadrons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura locuturi subito seducimur imbre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:385" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 385</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum frigida mors animā seduxerit artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 385</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto seductas aethere longe Despectat terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recessus gurgitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:902" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 902</bibl></cit>. —Of distance in an upward direction: <cit><quote lang="la">mons erat audaci seductus in aethera dorso,</quote> <trans><tr>far uplifted</tr>, <tr>lofty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:460" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia non publica sed in privato seductaque a plurium conscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illis non minus hos seductos et quasi rusticos,</quote> <trans><tr>retired</tr>, <tr>living in solitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seductum vitae genus,</quote> <trans><tr>retired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 19, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (hominum) maxime in seducto actiones sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>in retirement</tr>, <tr>solitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seductibilis: <entryFree id="n43317" type="main" key="se_ducti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēductĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> ( = seductilis) (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 54:22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 54, 22</bibl>.</entryFree>
seductilis: <entryFree id="n43318" type="main" key="se_ducti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēductĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seduco, I.
