B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n43318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be misled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seduced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seducible</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 166 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
seductio: <entryFree id="n43319" type="main" key="se_ducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>seduco</etym>. <sense id="n43319.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to seduco, I.) * </sense><sense id="n43319.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A leading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing aside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seductiones testium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43319.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A misleading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduction</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Adam confessus est seductionem, non occultavit seductricem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, § 218</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:23:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 23, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,014:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Thess. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n43319.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to seduco, II.) <hi rend="ital">A separation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors est corporis animaeque seductio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seductor: <entryFree id="n43320" type="main" key="se_ductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>seduco, I. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n43320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a misleader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seducer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Johan. 29" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Johan. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 63:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 63, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Johan. 7; cf.: seductor, <foreign lang="greek">pla/nos, a\pathth/s,</foreign> Gloss. Phil.</sense></entryFree>
seductorius: <entryFree id="n43321" type="main" key="se_ducto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēductōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seductor</etym>, <sense id="n43321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seductive</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 5:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Bon. Mor. 9, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seductrix: <entryFree id="n43322" type="hapax" key="se_ductrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēductrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that seduces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (v. seductio).</sense></entryFree>
seductus: <entryFree id="n43323" type="main" key="se_ductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n43323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a</hi>. of seduco.</sense></entryFree>
sedularia: <entryFree id="n43324" type="hapax" key="se_du^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sedes</etym>, <sense id="n43324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cushions</hi> of a carriage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sedule: <entryFree id="n43325" type="main" key="se_du^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sedulus <sense id="n43325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
sedulitas: <entryFree id="n43326" type="main" key="se_du^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdŭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sedulus</etym>. <sense id="n43326.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Assiduity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">application</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnestness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedulousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedulity</hi> (class.; syn. diligentia): Balbi quoque Cornelii operam et sedulitatem laudare possum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro sedulitate ac diligentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of ants: qui labor, quae sedulitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mea sedulitas aut insidiosa aut inpudens videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 12 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae sedulitatis anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:668" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sentitur sedulitate labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:434" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 434</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiosa sedulitas et opella forensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit> et al.—* </sense><sense id="n43326.1" n="II" level="1"> With an invidious implication, <hi rend="ital">officiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtrusiveness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitas stulte quem diligit urget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 260</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sedulius: <entryFree id="n43327" type="main" key="Seduli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sedulĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43327.1" n="I" level="1"> Caelius Sedulius, <hi rend="ital">a Latin Christian poet of</hi> <pb n="1661" /> <cb n="SEDU" /> <hi rend="ital">the fifth century</hi>, Ven. Fort. Vit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43327.2" n="II" level="1"> Sedulius, <hi rend="ital">a general of the Lemovices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sedulo: <entryFree id="n43328" type="main" key="se_du^lo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdŭlō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sedulus <sense id="n43328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
sedulus: <entryFree id="n43329" type="main" key="se_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; acc. to Curt. from root <foreign lang="greek">e(d-,</foreign> to go; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(do/s,</foreign> way; whence Lat. solum, solium; cf. tremulus, from tremo; prop. active, inclined to motion; but perh. better referred to root sed-, sid-, (Sanscr. sad-), of sedeo; Engl. sit; cf. assiduus. The derivation from sē - dolo, adopted by Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 374</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 28</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 244</bibl> and 247; cf. Döderl. Syn. 1, p. 117 sq. al., is an error</etym>; orig. sitting fast, persisting in some course of action; hence, <sense id="n43329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">busy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">industrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unremitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedulous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: diligens, officiosus, attentus): eloquentes videbare, non sedulos velle conquirere,</quote> <trans><tr>orators</tr>, <tr>not those who labor at oratory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:176" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 47, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec a concubitu fit sedula, tardior illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimat lentus spectator, sedulus inflat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum venerata virum hunc sedula curet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">puer (minister),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olitor, Col. poët. 10, 148: apis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:50" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:928" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 928</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:84" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 438</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducat juvenum sedula turba senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:80" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedula fune viri contento bracchia lassant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:297" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1109" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">industria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 128: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 267: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: velim te arbitrari factum. <hi rend="ital">R.</hi> Sedulum est, submoventur hostes, removentur lapides, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 194</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n43329.1" n="II" level="1"> With an invidious implication, <hi rend="ital">officious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtrusive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne studio nostri pecces odiumque libellis Sedulus importes opera vehemente minister,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam flammae sedulus addat aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">male sedulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 699</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 438</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43329.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdŭlō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">busily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">industriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zealously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unremittingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assiduously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sedulously.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43329.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (very freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite word of Plaut. and Ter.): nam ille amico suo sodali sedulo rem mandatam exsequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:71 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 71 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cognorant, dabimus operam sedulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">operam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare quae opus sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam sedulo, Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—Most freq. with <hi rend="ital">facere;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:47 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 47 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10</bibl> a, 2.—With <hi rend="ital">fieri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulo id ago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitans mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: ad socios nostros sedulo dispertieram, alio frumentum, alio legatos, etc., Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 197</bibl> P.; cf.: salutem impertit studiose et sedulo, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid conservare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum advertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munditer se habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Valuistine usque? <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Sustentatum'st sedulo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulo aliquid dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to assert emphatically</tr>, <tr>protest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 106</bibl></cit>; cf.: ego illud sedulo Negare factum; <cit><quote lang="la">ille instat factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 119</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">moneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et moneo, et hortor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sincerely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argumentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43329.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., with an implication of design, <hi rend="ital">on purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">designedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intentionally</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): aliquid occultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingit causas, ne det, sedulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam nisi in virtute spes est, milites, et ego sedulo, ne esset, feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus terere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46</bibl></cit>: imitari aliquem, <cb n="SEGE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43329.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēdŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">busily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, etc. (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">semper custos sedule circumire debet alvearia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: hoc munus implet sedule, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 5, 407; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sedum: <entryFree id="n43330" type="gloss" key="se^dum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdum</orth> = sed; v. sed. <sense id="n43330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43331" type="main" key="se^dum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">houseleek</hi> (called also aizoon, or digitellum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:356" default="NO">2, 10, 356</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:61" default="NO">11, 3, 61</bibl> sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seduni: <entryFree id="n43332" type="main" key="Sedu_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sedūni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Helvetian people</hi> in the region of the mod. <hi rend="ital">Sion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sitten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 248</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sedusii: <entryFree id="n43333" type="main" key="Sedusii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sedusii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seges: <entryFree id="n43334" type="main" key="se^ge^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕgĕs</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. root sag-, to fill, feed; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sa/ttw;</foreign> Lat. sagmen, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n43334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cornfield.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43334.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">partem dimidiam (stercoris) in segetem, ubi pabulum seras, invehito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36</bibl>: segetes subigere aratris, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 395, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">155</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4</bibl> (v. defrugo); id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:29:1" default="NO">1, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:50:1" default="NO">1, 50, 1</bibl> sq.; 1, 69, 1; 2, 7, 11 al.; Lucil., Att., and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 395, 24 sq.</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 28, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes secundae et uberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 15, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 8, § 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes frumentatum in proximas segetes misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 47</bibl> Heyne; 2, 267; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 129: segetes occat tibi mox frumenta daturas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Comically: stimulorum seges,</quote> <trans><tr>a cudgelfield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43334.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the standing corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growing corn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crop</hi> in a field (class., but not freq. till after the Aug. per.: <cit><quote lang="la">est eorum (rusticorum) gemmare vitis, laetas esse segetes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 155</bibl>, is cited, merely by way of example, as used by the rustici; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. messis): seges grandissima atque optima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culto stat seges alta solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges prope jam matura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. infra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">antequam seges in articulum eat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uligo segetem enecat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et segetis canae stantes percurrere aristas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">producit fruges et segetem imbecillem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 4, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes Collibus et campis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid faciat laetas segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adultae segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes laetas excitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetas segetes afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges farris matura messi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lini et avenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leguminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of men springing up out of the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">crescit seges clipeata virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:59 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 59 al.</bibl>—Of a multitude of things crowded together, <hi rend="ital">a crop</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">confixum ferrea texit Telorum seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 526</bibl>, and 12, 663; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 391</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Mavortia ferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hystricis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 2</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Hystr. 12</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">aëna (hydraulici organi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges osculationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 48, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43334.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43334.4" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. A.) <hi rend="ital">A field</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soil</hi> (rare but class.): quod beneficium haud sterili in segete, rex, te obsesse intellegis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 395, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert casiam non culta seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi prima paretur Arboribus seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid odisset Clodium Milo segetem ac materiem suae gloriae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videtur esse criminum seges, maledictorum materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 172</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43334.5" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">A crop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fertile pectus habes, interque Helicona colentes Uberius nulli provenit ista seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae inde seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde seges scelerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 258</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
segesta: <entryFree id="n43335" type="main" key="Se^gesta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕgesta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sibilated, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=340" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 340</bibl> Müll., on account of the omen, from <foreign lang="greek">*)/Egesta</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n43335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city on the northern coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mount Eryx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 40, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=340" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 340</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕgestānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Segesta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Segestan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 32, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43335.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕgestānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Segestan territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:40:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 40, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43335.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕ-gestāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Segesta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Segestans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 43</bibl>. <cb n="SEGN" /></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n43336" type="main" key="Se^gesta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕgesta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Segetia.</entryFree>
segestanus: <entryFree id="n43337" type="main" key="Se^gesta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕgestānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Segesta.</entryFree>
segestes: <entryFree id="n43338" type="main" key="Segestes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Segestes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father-in-law of Arminius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and friend of the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 57</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
segestica: <entryFree id="n43339" type="main" key="Se^gesti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕgestĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Celtiberi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
segestre: <entryFree id="n43340" type="main" key="se^gestre"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕgestre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕges-trĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=166" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 166</bibl> Müll.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕ-gestra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Edict. Diocl. p. 23), <sense id="n43340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrapper</hi> of straw or hides for shielding goods or persons from the weather: segestre, <foreign lang="greek">difqe/ra, difqe/ra ploi/ou,</foreign> Gloss. Vet.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: segestre, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 76</bibl>; Edict. Diocl. p. 23.—As <hi rend="ital">a sort of mantle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">segestri vel lodiculā involutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
segetalis: <entryFree id="n43341" type="main" key="se^ge^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕgĕtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seges</etym>, <sense id="n43341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to standing crops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiolus,</quote> <trans><tr>a weed that grows among green corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
segetia: <entryFree id="n43342" type="main" key="Se^ge^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕgĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess that protects the standing crops</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕgesta</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 8</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. vol. 4, p. 15.</sense></entryFree>
segmen: <entryFree id="n43343" type="main" key="segmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>seco</etym>, <sense id="n43343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">what is cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little bit</hi> (very rare): unguium et capilli segmina, Fab. Pictor ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli secabile segmen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>atom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: cannarum duplex fixa perpetuitas nec segmina, nec rimam ullam fieri patietur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will prevent the work from chipping off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cracking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
segmentatus: <entryFree id="n43344" type="main" key="segmenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segmentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>segmentum</etym>, <sense id="n43344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornamented with strips of tinsel</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">trimmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flounced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purfled</hi> (mostly postclass. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n43344.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:42" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: TORALIA, Inscr. Fratr. Arval. 32 and 41.—* </sense><sense id="n43344.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">paginae Tulliano segmentatae auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
segmentum: <entryFree id="n43345" type="main" key="segmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>seco</etym>, <sense id="n43345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut; a piece cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slice</hi> (not ante-Aug.; mostly in the <number>plur.</number>; syn.: fragmentum, frustum). </sense><sense id="n43345.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">crassior harena laxioribus segmentis terit et plus erodit marmoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">segmenta percae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43345.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43345.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A strip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">segment</hi> of the earth: <cit><quote lang="la">plura sunt haec segmenta mundi, quae nostri circulos appellavere, Graeci parallelos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinto continentur segmento Bactra, Iberia, Armenia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 216</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43345.4" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">strips of tinsel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brocade</hi>, etc., sewed around the bottom of a woman's dress; <hi rend="ital">trimmings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flounces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purfles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">segmenta et longos habitus et flammea sumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:124" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: crepitantia, Sed. Ep. 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
segne: <entryFree id="n43346" type="main" key="segne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. segnis <sense id="n43346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign></sense></entryFree>
segnesco: <entryFree id="n43347" type="hapax" key="segnesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segnesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>segnis</etym>, <sense id="n43347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become slow; to abate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decrease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:110" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
segni: <entryFree id="n43348" type="main" key="Segni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Segni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe in Gallia Belgica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Eburones and Treviri</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Signei</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Condroy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
segnipes: <entryFree id="n43349" type="hapax" key="segni^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segnĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>segnis</etym>, <sense id="n43349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowfool</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation of a worn-out horse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
segnis: <entryFree id="n43350" type="main" key="segnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commonly referred to sequor, that follows after, creeps after</etym>, <sense id="n43350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dilatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lingering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unenergetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lazy</hi> (in <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi> not freq. till after the Aug. per., esp. in the histt.; in Cic. only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, except in a passage from Non.; in Caes. only once in <hi rend="ital">comp.;</hi> syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">deses, ignavus, desidiosus, piger): (servi) quia tardius irent Propter onus segnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tardum et segne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 83</bibl></cit>: animus (opp. mobilis), Trogas ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 52, 114, § 275</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer segnis et jacens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnis inersque vocer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:58" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: segniores castigat atque incitat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudando promptos et castigando segnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnes et pavidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa quae segnibus ardua videantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnior esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, B <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus segnior fit ubi neglegas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne segniores viris feminas habere viderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:27" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus aut morbo gravis aut segnior annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 95</bibl></cit> et saep.: in quo tua me provocavit oratio, mea consecuta est segnis (segnius?), Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 33, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 10</bibl>: <pb n="1662" /> <cb n="SEGN" /> bellum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 563</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes (in the race),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arar,</quote> <trans><tr>slowly-flowing</tr>, <tr>sluggish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: stellae (<hi rend="ital">Ursa Major and Minor and Boötes</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:484" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 484</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unfruitful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arvum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 438</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 690" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter (terror) diutinus, sed segnior,</quote> <trans><tr>slower</tr>, <tr>more lingering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnior mors (per venenum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 310, 21</bibl>.—With a <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non segnior discordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Sagunti oppugnatio segnior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud illo segnior ibat Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 383</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 414</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43350.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Ad aliquid</hi>, less freq. <hi rend="ital">in aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliquam rem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">segniores posthac ad imperandum ceteri sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 7, 17</bibl></cit> (3, 7); so in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad respondendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad persequendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:50" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad credendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alia facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gnarus gentem segnem ad pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatu segniore in exsequendis conatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in Venerem segnes nocturnaque bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 736</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Maxim.</author> Eleg. 5, 50</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43350.2" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">occasionum haud segnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeti praedā et aliorum segnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43350.3" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">segnes nodum solvere Gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 19</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">slowly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slothfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lazily.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43350.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">segnĭter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">segniter, otiose, neglegenter, contumaciter omnia agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:87:1" default="NO">2, 87, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:106 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 106 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43350.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">segnē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud segne id ipsum tempus consumpserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil agendum segne ratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43350.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: segnius atque timidius pro re publicā niti, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">segnius socordiusque oppugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:180 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 180 al.</bibl>—Esp. freq. with the negg. <hi rend="ital">non</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nihilo</hi> segnius (for which, in the MSS., sequius or secius is freq. interchanged), <hi rend="ital">none the slower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not the less actively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnestly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">zealously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the same activity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">earnestness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with undiminished zeal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ideo tamen segnius precor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non segnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud segnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 534</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 286</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec segnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque segnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eo segnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidani nihilo segnius bellum parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo segnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 18</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 26, 12; 32, 22; 35, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 2, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n43350.7" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautae torpedinis tactu segnissime torpuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
segnitas: <entryFree id="n43351" type="main" key="segni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>segnis</etym>, ante-class. for the class. segnitia, <sense id="n43351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dilatoriness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 23</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 174, 21</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:41:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 41, 185</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 251, 23</bibl>; v. segnitia).</sense></entryFree>
segniter: <entryFree id="n43352" type="main" key="segni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segnĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. segnis <sense id="n43352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
segnitia: <entryFree id="n43353" type="main" key="segni^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segnĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae, and</itype> (less freq.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">segnĭ-tĭes</orth>, <itype>em, ē</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>segnis</etym>, <sense id="n43353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dilatoriness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: desidia, ignavia, pigritia, socordia). </sense><sense id="n43353.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form segnitia: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quod segnitia erat sapientia vocaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: nihil loci'st segnitiae neque socordiae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudem esse omnino in nostris poëtis aut inertissimae segnitiae est aut fastidii delicatissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem segnitiae accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnitiae nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultatis patrocinia praeteximus segnitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob segnitiam non vindicatae fratris injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnitia in asserendā libertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 8</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui segnitiam juvenis juxta insultet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine segnitiā verecundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:282" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne temere coepta segnitia insuper everteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnitia maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43353.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form segnities: <cit><quote lang="la">in hujusmodi negotio Diem sermone terere, segnities mera'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: quae tam sera moratur Segnities? * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 374</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te socordiam omnem reice et segnitiem amove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: castigemus etiam segnitiem hominum atque inertiam, Cic. de <cb n="SEGU" /> Or. 1, 41, 185 B. and K. (al. segnitatem acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 21</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut castigaret segnitiem populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in desidiam segnitiemque conversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post nimiam ventorum segnitiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cunctatione ac segnitie perstare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
segnities: <entryFree id="n43354" type="main" key="segni^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segnĭtĭes</orth>, v. segnitia.</entryFree>
segobriga: <entryFree id="n43355" type="main" key="Se_go^_bri_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēgŏ_brīga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*shgo/briga,</foreign> <sense id="n43355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief town of the Celtiberians</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis), near the modern <hi rend="ital">Priego</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 160</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēgobrī-genses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Segobriga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
segontiaci: <entryFree id="n43356" type="main" key="Segonti^a^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Segontĭăci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the southern part of Britannia</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Hampshire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2013</bibl>.<</sense></entryFree>
segredior: <entryFree id="n43357" type="main" key="se_gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>grĕdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>gradior</etym>, <sense id="n43357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go aside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oculis et auribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
segregatim: <entryFree id="n43358" type="main" key="se_gre^ga_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēgrĕgātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>segrego</etym>, <sense id="n43358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi> (late Lat.), Prud. Ham. praef. 39.</sense></entryFree>
segregatio: <entryFree id="n43359" type="hapax" key="se_gre^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēgrĕgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">segregation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
segregis: <entryFree id="n43360" type="main" key="se_gre^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēgrĕgis</orth>, v. segrex.</entryFree>
segrego: <entryFree id="n43361" type="main" key="se_gre^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-grĕgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n43361.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">seque gregari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 452</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>grex</etym>. </sense><sense id="n43361.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To set apart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">separate from the flock</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oves segregatas (a capellis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater Segregat egregiam subolem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 156 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicut pastor segregat oves ab haedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 25, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43361.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen. (cf. congrego, II.), <hi rend="ital">to set apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put away; to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">segregate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43361.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 452</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exclusit illum a re publicā, distraxit, segregavit scelus ipsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo non segregandum a numero civium verum etiam adsciscendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne abs te hanc segreges neu deseras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus ab se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 23</bibl>; 5, 2, 30; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:184" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 184</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: captivis productis segregatisque, <hi rend="ital">separated</hi> (the allies and the Romans), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43361.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove away</hi> from; <hi rend="ital">to divide</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sepono, sejungo, removeo): spes, opes auxiliaque ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista feritas a communi tamquam humanitatis corpore segreganda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (eloquendi vis) nos a vitā immani et ferā segregavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem et culpam ab se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem a summo bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis causam a Polyarato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">publicam causam a privatorum culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iambum et trochaeum frequentem segregat ab oratore Aristoteles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(beata vita) a comitatu pulcherrimo segregata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 80</bibl></cit>: cives ore obscena dicta segregent, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 357, 16</bibl>, and 206, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be silent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 136</bibl>; cf.: ore obscena segregent, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 357, 13</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 511 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut segregaret pugnam eorum (Curiatiorum),</quote> <trans><tr>divide</tr>, <tr>separate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a peccatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to set apart for</hi> a special work, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 13, 2</bibl>.—<mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēgrĕgātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> segregatior, <hi rend="ital">more isolated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Orig. Prin. 1, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
segregus: <entryFree id="n43362" type="main" key="se_gre^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēgrĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. segrex.</entryFree>
segrex: <entryFree id="n43363" type="main" key="se_grex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-grex</orth>, <itype>ĕgis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēgrĕgus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 8, 10</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grex</etym>, <sense id="n43363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> (post-Aug. and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">agere vitam segregem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segregem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 1208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates situ segreges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">segrege formā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>different</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ham. 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segrege regno,</quote> <trans><tr>divided</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
segullum: <entryFree id="n43364" type="main" key="segullum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">segullum</orth>, v. segutilum.</entryFree>
